The atmosphere of isolation and suspense surrounds the gamer throughout the whole of the game, leaving him face to face with his phobias. The voice of an invisible "observer" broadcasting over the system of inner communication accompanies us. But whose voice is it – a friend's or an enemy's one?

Source: The Developer Website.

154709.name: Cards Against Librarianship
154709.description:
A library-themed spin on the popular Cards Against Humanity.

To begin, each player is dealt 10 white cards, and one player (the judge) begins the game by flipping over the first black card. The other players then put down one white card each that fill in the blank on the black card. The judge then decides which submission they think is funniest. The player who submitted the winning card gets to keep the black card.

The game is free to print and share online.


Cards Against Librarianship by Emily Lloyd is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

154710.name: Bog Billy
154710.description:
Taken from the publisher blurb:

Dwelling in the crawl spaces and rubble covered heaps of the Old Ones, live cunning man eaters known as Bog-Billies. Although slow in the open street or swampland trail, they are often much faster than a humanoid excavator who, on his or her hands and knees, has fallen for the bait, and foolishly crept into the ambush of these foul mutants.

Also called Floor Devils and Nailbiters, these disturbing looking, distant human off shoots are the 5th in The Mutant Epoch RPG’s free line of Creatures of the Apocalypse.

This 7 page document includes a close up player handout version as well as a highly useful old school blue inked ruin map showing a typical Bog-Billy lair denoting baiting points, tunnels, and bone and relic filled larders where captive PCs are taken to await their grisly fate. This foul mutant’s description also includes a ‘bait item’ treasure table and rich selection of mutations to make them extra nasty.

154711.name: Brutal Labyrinth
154711.description:
Brutal Labyrinth is a unique labyrinth. With brutal force, fire and explosions, your mission is to guide the ball to the final destination. The obstacles on the way differs on every level.

Brutal Labyrinth features hours of gameplay, challenging physics-based labyrinth demolition, and lots of replay value. Each of the 42 levels requires logic, skill, and brute force to find the way.

The ball is a bomb, a suicide ball, with a fuse. When the fuze is lit, the ball will explode in seconds. Then it’s up to you to be at the right place. You control the ball by tilting the iPhone or iPad. You can calibrate he game for a suitable playing position.

FEATURES:
42 gorgeous looking Levels
Game Center Support, compete with your friends
Great music and sound effect
Realistic Physics
Calibrate and play the way you hold your device

Source: The Developer Website.

154713.name: The Body Changer
154713.description:
The Body Changer was born from the game Effing Dead. But why the name change? It’s still on space, still action, still adventure but with a new mechanic that alters the gameplay style.
After we started with the gfx restyle we discussed a lot about new ideas that we decided to introduce – a lot of new ideas and concepts. So many that, at some point, we thought this game isn’t really Effing Dead.

Source: The Developer Website.

rpgitemversion: CD with jpg and PDF files
154715.name: Grundrisse für Dörfer
154715.description:
publisher blurb

Das Überlebenspaket für Spielleiter, die keine Zeit haben, selbst ein Dorf oder typische Gebäude eines Dorfes zu entwerfen. Hier findet er 13 typische Dorfgebäude als Grundrisse, meist mit Ansicht, sieben fertige Dorfpläne und einen Text über das Leben im Dorf. Geeignet am besten für Welten mit einem dem Mittelalter entsprechenden Hintergrund. MSP II gibt es als Mappe (56 S., Spiralbindung) oder als CD-ROM (pdf-, bmp-, gif- und jpg-Dateien).

translation from Google

The survival kit for game leaders who have no time even to design a village or typical buildings of a village. Here, he takes 13 typical village buildings as floor plans, most with view, finished seven village maps and a text about life in the village. Best suited for environments with a medieval corresponding background. MSP II is available as a folder (56 pages, spiral binding) or as a CD-ROM (pdf, bmp, gif and jpg files).

rpgitemversion: CD with jpg and PDF files
154716.name: Grundrisse für moderne Zeiten
154716.description:
publisher blurb

Das Überlebenspaket für Spielleiter mit wenig Zeit: Master´s Survival Pack III – Grundrisse für moderne Zeiten startet in die Welt von heute und morgen. Neun verschiedene Gebäude mit Ansichten erwarten ihre Besucher. Einige sind nach dem Baukastenprinzip gestaltet, so dass jeder selbst noch weiterbauen kann, z. B. das Einkaufszentrum.
Das alles findet sich in der Mappe (56 S., Spiralbindung) oder auf CD-ROM (pdf-, gif-, bmp- und jpg-Dateien).

Google translation

The survival kit for game manager with little time: Master's Survival Pack III - floor plans for modern times started in the world of today and tomorrow. Nine different building with views await their visitors. Some are designed on a modular basis so that everyone can continue to build even more, such as the shopping center.
All this can be found in the folder (56 pages, spiral binding) or on CD-ROM (pdf, gif, bmp and jpg files).

rpgitemversion: CD with jpg and PDF files
Swift Ships & Battered Boats Game Master's Survival Pack - Volume II
154717.name: Grundrisse für Schiffe
154717.description:
publisher blurb

Ahoi an alle RollenspielerInnen, die in ihren Abenteuern mal Seeluft schnuppern möchten. Kim Schneider hat acht verschiedene Schiffe vom Stapel laufen lassen: vom Papyrusboot aus dem alten Ägypten über antike Trieren und mittelalterliche Koggen bis zur klassischen Galeone aus diversen Piratenfilmen. Und für die Liebhaber des Exotischen gibt´s noch eine Dschunke dazu. Die Flotte segelt im Konvoi mit einigen Texten: jeweils ein kurzer Überblick über die Seefahrt in Antike, Mittelalter und Früher Neuzeit, ein Seemannslexikon und zu jedem Schiff eine Beschreibung und ein Abenteuervorschlag. Das alles wieder als Mappe oder CD.

Google translation

Ahoy to all role players who want a taste of sea air times in their adventures. Kim Schneider has had eight different ships launched: from papyrus boat from ancient Egypt to ancient triremes and medieval cogs to classic galleon from various pirate movies. And for lovers of the exotic's even to a junk. The fleet sailed in convoy with some texts: in each case a brief overview of seafaring in ancient, medieval and early modern period, a sailor lexicon and for each vessel to a description and an adventure proposal. All this again as a portfolio or CD.

rpgitemversion: CD with jpg and PDF files
154718.name: Grundrisse für Raumstationen
154718.description:
publisher blurb

Georg Joergens hat gekonnt viele verschiedene Teile einer Raumstation entworfen, angefangen vom Hangar über Wohneinheiten und Kommandozentrale bis hin zur Rettungskapsel. Das Besondere: alle Teile passen zueinander, so dass sich jeder wie aus einem Baukasten seine eigene Station kreieren kann – oder mehrere unterschiedliche. Egal, ob als Raum- oder Planetenstation, ob unter- oder oberirdisch. Dazu gibt es zehn Abenteuervorschläge.
Die CD-Version ist diesmal in Farbe.

Google translation

Georg Joergens has skillfully designed many different parts of a space station, from the hangar on residential units and command centers, including a rescue capsule. The special feature: all parts fit together, so that everyone can create his own station as a kit - or more different. Whether as a space station or planet, whether below or above ground. There are ten suggestions adventure.
The CD version is in color this time.

rpgitemversion: CD with jpg and PDF files
154719.name: Grundrisse für Dungeons
154719.description:
publisher blurb

Dunkle Gänge, gespickt mit Fallen, die zu Räumen voller Monster führen – das wohl häufigste Setting aus den Anfangstagen des Rollenspiels ist nie ganz aus der Mode gekommen. Ob Höhlensysteme, Minen oder planvoll konstruierte Anlagen – so vielfältig wie die Dungeonformen sind auch die Grundrisse. Da es aber unter der Erde meistens dunkel ist, kennt nur der Spielleiter den Weg. Er legt aus der Vielzahl von Gängen und Räumen nach und nach den Weg an: von der Eingangshalle durch fackelerleuchtete Gänge hin zur Grabkammer, von dort hinab in die verlassenen Bereiche, wo Verfall und Ratten hausen und Einstürze und Fallen die Abenteurer bedrohen, wie die Hinterlassenschaften unglücklicher Vorgänger zeigen.
Wie bei einem Puzzle kann der Spielleiter aus Gangstücken und Räumen mit unterschiedlichem Untergrund viele verschiedene Dungeons bauen. Zur weiteren Ausgestaltung gibt es Fallen, Einstürze und etliches andere Interieur. Sechs Texte in Form kurzer Geschichten bieten Vorschläge für spannende Abenteuer. Alles systemunabhängig, spielbar auf jeder Welt, die unter der Erde mehr zu bieten hat als Dreck und Steine.
Diese Dungeons findet ihr in der bekannten Mappe mit Spiralbindung (66 S., alle Pläne farbig) oder auf der inhaltsgleichen CD (in Farbe, pdf- und jpg-Dateien).

Google translation

Dark halls , filled with traps that lead to rooms full of monsters - probably the most common setting of the early days of role-playing has never come completely out of fashion. Whether caves , mines or plan fully constructed assets - as diverse as the Dungeon forms are also the plans . But since under the earth is mostly dark, only the GM knows the way. He lays out the plurality of passageways and rooms gradually the way : from the entrance hall through fackelerleuchtete transitions towards the grave chamber and from there down to the abandoned areas where decay and rats live and collapses and traps threaten the adventurers , as the legacies unfortunate predecessor show .
Like a jigsaw puzzle of the game master of transition pieces and spaces with different surfaces can build many different dungeons . To further embodiment, there are traps, cave-ins and up some other interior. Six texts in the form of short stories offer suggestions for exciting adventures . All system-independent , playable on any world that has more to offer under the earth. Than dirt and rocks
These dungeons can be found in the known folder with spiral binding (66 pp., all layouts in color ) or on the same content CD ( in color , pdf and jpg files).

rpgitemversion: CD with jpg and PDF files
154720.name: Grundrisse für Gaslight
154720.description:
publisher blurb

Hier findet der Spielleiter eine Auswahl an sieben Gebäuden, die typisch für die viktorianische Zeit Ende des 19. Jahrhunderts sind, auch Gaslight-Epoche genannt.
Die wundervollen Grundrisse von Chris Schlicht führen uns von den prachtvollen und komfortablen Residenzen des Adels und reichen Bürgertums über Beispiele für das Arbeitsleben (Ziegelei, Schneiderei), das Reisen (Bahnhof) und das Wohnen der Mittelschicht (Stadthaus, Schneiderei) in die einfachen und engen Behausungen der Arbeiter (Hinterhaus, Kutscherwohnung, Dienstbotenzimmer).
Zu jedem Gebäude gibt es einen Abenteuervorschlag bzw. ein Szenario. Diese passen zur viktorianischen Zeit und besonders zum Detektivrollenspiel Private Eye. Alle bisherigen Autoren von Private Eye haben einen Text beigesteuert. Jeder hat entdeckt, dass Chris’ Gebäude nur von außen harmlos aussehen. In allen finden in Wirklichkeit mordsmäßige und haarsträubende Ereignisse statt oder hängen zumindest eng mit dem Ort oder den Bewohnern zusammen. Herausgekommen ist eine bunte Sammlung von spannenden Fällen, die von vorsätzlichem Mord bis hin zum Diebstahl reichen.

Google translation

Here, the game master will find a selection of seven buildings , typical of the Victorian period end of the 19th Century , also called Gaslight era .
The wonderful floor plans by Chris simplicity lead us from the lovely and comfortable residences of the nobility and rich bourgeoisie of examples for Working Life ( brick , tailoring ) , traveling (train station) and the living of the middle class (town house , tailoring ) in the simple and narrow dwellings of the workers (rear house , coach-house , servants' quarters ) .
There is an adventure proposal or a scenario to each building. These fit Victorian times and especially to Detective RPG Private Eye . All previous authors of Private Eye have contributed a text. Everyone has discovered that Chris' building look harmless from the outside. In all whopping and hair-raising events take place in reality, or at least closely related to the place or the people together . The result is a colorful collection of exciting cases , ranging from premeditated murder to stealing .

154721.name: boxes
154721.description:
In boxes, six containers of ten "box" cards will be sold one by one. The player who bids the highest gets the entire container. The game ends when all six containers have been sold.

To start, one player takes the auctioneer's token, which gives him the right to choose the type of auction (open or secret), then to be the first person to look at the cards in the lot. The token rotates clockwise from player to player with each new turn. Each player in turn gets actions that he has to use in one go to discreetly inspect box cards. Once each player has used his actions, the auction takes place.

Once the six containers (all sixty box cards) have been sold, each player counts his wealth (remaining banknotes + value of the box cards). For each set he holds, a player receives a bonus of 250 ECU. Whoever has the most wealth wins.

154722.name: Noppapeli
154722.description: In this game you try to be the first player to complete your 6-piece puzzle. The die shows you which puzzle piece you can take from the table – if it fits in your puzzle, you get to keep it!

154723.description:
Rebuild your castle before dragons block your way
- acting/moving by turns -

A storm has destroyed Drago-Tuku's castle, the only place where inhabitants get shelter against the island dragons; the knights have to search for the 9 shattered parts before the dragons overwhelm you/them.

Each player moves forward according to the die roll and pick up a part if the move ends on a missing piece; bring it back, put it up and start again - if the die shows a 'dragon' a new monster is added and moves along your way. If you meet one you must escape into the magic wood. You still may roll the die, but only you can escape if the die shows a 'sun'. Anyone who throws a sun (let you leap over dragons and define a number between 1-5, too) can dedicate his/her turn to someone else.

If all 5 dragons are out and block your way team has lost the game.
154723.name: Drago-Tuku

154724.name: Noms
154724.description:
Noms is a four-player Whist-like card game with bidding, in which the bidder's partner is chosen by calling a card, and the identity of the partner remains secret until the called card is played. A standard 52 card pack is used.

Deal
Any player may deal first, and the turn to deal passes to the left after each hand. The cards are not shuffled between deals: the dealer simply gathers the cards from the previous hand, stacking the tricks together, cuts the pack and starts dealing. The deal will result in everyone having a hand of 13 cards.

Bidding
Bids are an undertaking to win at least the stated number of tricks with the help of a partner chosen by nominating a card. The bidder will choose the trump suit but the bids do not mention a suit, only the number of tricks.

Play
The highest bidder leads to the first trick, naming the trump suit and the called card. The identity of the partner is definitively revealed only when the called card is played, though it may be guessed earlier because the partner will try to play cards that will help the bidder.

Scoring
The bid succeeds if the bidder together with the holder of the nominated card win at least as many tricks as the number that was bid. In this case they each score the amount of the bid. If the bidder and partner fail to win enough tricks between them, the other two players score the amount of the bid.

A separate cumulative score is kept for each player and the game can continue until someone reaches the agreed target score, typically 101. The player with most points then wins.

154725.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

This is a game similar to Mastermind but smaller. Each player receives a screen, 3 monkeys (red, blue, yellow) and a board with 6 spaces from 1 to 6.

Each round a player will hide his monkeys (in spaces 1 to 6) while the other tries to guess their location. For that the second player will place her monkeys where she thinks player 1 has his and reveal her board. Player 1 then has to say how many monkeys are in the right position and so on until she gets it right. Then the roles will be exchanged. The player that guesses the right combination in the fewest tries will be the winner.
154725.name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Such Die Affen

154726.name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Buchstaben-Spiel
154726.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

The object of the game is to win as many Word cards as possible.

Each round a player will reveal one of the cards (that are placed on the table) and spin the roulette. Then all players will try to say a word that starts with the letter indicated by the roulette and that is in the concept shown by the cards. The first player to do so will win the card.

Cards can have the following categories: profession, food, vehicle, drink, country, name, plant, star, animal.

Content: 1 letters roulette, 9 word cards

154727.description:
Black Stories are morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

This was published as a special collector's edition with 110 stories, containing the 50 stories from Black Stories, the 50 stories from Black Stories 2 and 10 additional fan made stories.
154727.name: Black Stories 1+2

154728.description:
Kosmiczna misja is a tile placing children's game. The goal of the game is to gather as many space stations on planets as possible.

The active player rolls a die and either starts a new planet or continues to build one of his (maximum two) open ones. If the player wants to add a tile to an old planet, he has to roll on the die more than the number of finished space stations on the planet.

Then, the available tiles are replenished, and the next player takes his turn. The player with most stations at the end wins.
154728.name: Kosmiczna misja
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

154729.name: Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Lady Liberty Larceny
154729.description:
User Summary

Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Lady Liberty Larceny is the first game in the Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math series of edutainment games for WiiWare Download service. The game play is an adventure game with puzzles to answer like the Professor Layton series. In this game the Statue of Liberty has been stolen and you must recover it and apprehend the criminal.

154730.name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Wo war's?
154730.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

Content: 8 big cards, 8 small cards, 1 pawn, 1 die.

The big cards are placed in a circle face up. Small cards are placed in the center face down. In a turn you roll the die and advance the pawn. Then you must try to reveal the small card that matches the picture in the big card where the pawn is. If you do so you can keep the small card. If the small card is already in front of another player you take it from him. If you are the one holding the small card requested, then you win!

154731.name: Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Big Ben Burglary
154731.description:
User Summary

Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Big Ben Burglary is the second game in the Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math series of edutainment games for WiiWare Download service. The game play is an adventure game with puzzles to answer like the Professor Layton series. In this game the Big Ben bell has been stolen and you must recover it and apprehend the criminal.

154732.name: Last Stop
154732.description:
Publisher Blurp:

Last Stop is an introductory free scenario for Kuro.

Six strangers find themselves at a deserted crossroads in a forgotten part of Shin-Edo. What spirits have trapped them here, and are the strangers actually who they appear to be?

154733.name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Duade
154733.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

12 numbered cards in 2 colors are placed face down in the table.
On a turn you must throw 2 dice and then revealed 2 number cards. If the number and colors of the cards match the ones on the dice you receive a triumph chip. Then you place the cards face down again. If they don’t match then the other players in turn try to revealed the corresponding cards.

The game ends when a player gets 2 triumph chips.

154734.name: Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Great Gateway Grab
154734.description:
User Summary

Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Great Gateway Grab is the fourth game in the Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math series of edutainment games for WiiWare Download service. The game play is an adventure game with puzzles to answer like the Professor Layton series. In this game the St. Basil's cathedral has been stolen and you must recover it and apprehend the criminal.

154735.name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Mausefalle
154735.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

A player holds a cup while the others have a mouse by the tail (they are in the middle of the table touching by their noses). Then the player holding the cup rolls a die and must quickly catch the mouse of the color indicated by de die.

Only the player with the corresponding mouse can move his mouse trying to escape.

If the player holding the cup catches the mouse, they receive a victory point. If not, it is gained by the player owner of the mouse (who will have the cup now).

If another "mouse" moves its owner must move around the table in 4 feet.

The game ends when a player reaches 5 victory points.

154736.name: Ravensburger Spiele Minis: Waschtag
154736.description:
"Spiele Minis" is a series of small surprise boxes (i.e., you don't know what you get) from Ravensburger. They are meant to be carry-on or gifts, suitable for children ("Mitbringspiel"). Some of the cubes contain actual games, others contain magic tricks, puzzles etc.

20 pieces of cloth are placed in the middle of the table. Each player has a clothes line.

On your turn you must throw a die and you get a cloth in the corresponding color, which you hang on your clothes line. If no cloths of that color are left then you receive nothing.

If you throw a sun you must take a sunbeam and place it aside (there are 6). If the sun in the die is shining you can chose any cloth from the middle, but if its unhappy you must return one of yours to the middle (or one of an opponent if you don’t have any left).

The game ends when the sixth sunbeam is taken. The player with more cloth on his clothes line wins!

154737.name: Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Island of Diamonds
154737.description:
User Summary

Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math: The Island of Diamonds is the fifth game in the Carmen Sandiego Adventures in Math series of edutainment games for WiiWare Download service. The game play is an adventure game with puzzles to answer like the Professor Layton series. In this game you must infiltrate Carmen Sandiego’s secret island and stop her once and for all.

154738.name: Carmen Sandiego: Junior Detective Edition
154738.description:
Although not a version of Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? by name, Carmen Sandiego Junior Detective (sometimes referred to as Carmen Sandiego Junior Detective Edition, Junior Detective Edition, or Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego: Junior Detective Edition) is essentially a simplified version of it for pre-readers. Allgame says the game "is geared for younger users, with only 14 cases to solve". The lead characters of the FOX animated series Where on Earth is Carmen Sandiego?, Zack and Ivy were included in the game, along with Stretch - "ACME's crime-tracking dog". The French game of the game is "Mais où se cache Carmen Sandiego ? Edition Junior".

Production notes

Although Zack, Ivy, the Chief and Carmen Sandiego seem to have the same voice actors as in Earth, Carmen's appearance is different than in the show. Aside from including these characters and the fact that the user is addressed as "Player," the game has little to do with the Earth show.

ACME's Stretch the Crime Dog and Stretch's nemesis Carmine, Carmen Sandiego's pet cat, are introduced in this game. According to the game manual, Stretch captured so many V.I.L.E. agents as a puppy that ACME gave him "The Golden Snout Award," its highest K-9 honor. Stretch later appeared in one episode ("The Remnants") of the Earth series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Carmen Sandiego Junior Detective", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154739.name: Carmen Sandiego's Great Chase Through Time
154739.description:
Carmen Sandiego's Great Chase Through Time is a 1997 rebooted version of the 1989 game Where in Time Is Carmen Sandiego?. The game was strongly influenced by the short-lived PBS Kids game show of the same name. It was published by Brøderbund, which previewed the game at the 1997 Toy Fair in New York City. After Brøderbund was sold to The Learning Company in 1999, the game was re-released with a minimal redesign (including being renamed to its current title) on June 1 of that year. The game is recommended for ages 9 and up.

The game's narrative involves master thief Carmen Sandiego, who has used a time machine called the Chronoskimmer to plant her associates at key historical events, aiming to influence history by stopping these events from occurring. The objective of the game is to track down Carmen Sandiego and her henchmen by jumping through time tunnels that link historical periods together, and correct the course of history. The player visits well-known historical events, such as the signing of the Declaration of Independence and Lewis and Clark's expedition to the Pacific Northwest, and meets historical figures including Queen Hatshepsut, William the Conqueror, and Yuri Gagarin. In each segment, or case, the player must work out which items have been stolen and solve historical puzzles to stop Carmen's villains. By the end of case 18, they will have the tools to chase and capture Carmen in the final case.

Source: Wikipedia, "Carmen Sandiego's Great Chase Through Time", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154740.name: Myrskyn Aika
154740.description:
Translated from back of the book:
Myrskyn Aika (Time of the Storm) is a fantasy roleplaying game that is as suitable for plaiyng at a table describing the events as well as a LARP, dressing up as the characters and acting their actions.

This book contains everything relevant for playing and offers players excellent possibilities for continuous development of the game. It consists of three books, each more secret than the previous: the first book includes basics, the second the background descriptions and the third the gamemaster materials.
The book has maps to illustrate the event locations and drawn art.
Myrskyn Aika is the first well-balanced RPG book - a historical opening in the world of roleplaying.
Mike Pohjola has organized multiple roleplaying games and RPG events. He is a playwright and editor-in-chief of culture magazine Ei.

Back of the book in finnish:
Myrskyn Aika on fantasiaroolipeli, joka sopii pelattavaksi niin pöydän ääressä tapahtumia kuvaillen kuin larppina hahmoksi pukeutuen ja niiden toimia näytellen.

Tämä kirja sisältää kaiken oleellisen ja tarjoaa pelaajille erinomaiset mahdollisuudet pelin jatkuvaan kehittämiseen. Se koostuu kolmesta kirjasta, joiden salaisuusaste kasvaa aina edetessä: ensimmäinen kirja sisältää perusteet, toinen taustakuvaukset ja kolmas pelinjohtajan ohjeet.
Kirjassa on kartat tapahtumapaikkojen hahmottamiseksi sekä piirroskuvitus.
Myrskyn Aika on ensimmäinen täysipainoinen roolipelikirja - historiallinen pelinavaus roolipelaamisen maailmassa.
Mike Pohjola on järjestänyt useita roolipelejä ja alan tapahtumia. hän on kirjoittanut mm. näytelmiä ja on kulttuurilehti Ein päätoimittaja.

154741.name: Wo versteckt sich das Gespenst?
154741.description:
Objective: get rid of your cards
- acting by turns -
32 cards (8 each green, red, blue, yellow) are shuffled & placed upside down; one card is flipped; active player draws a card;
if there is a matching colour drop both and flip a new one for next player - otherwise keep drawing and keep the non-matching ones in your hand, hidden.

If all cards are gone on the table: use your hand cards; last player with cards in her/his hand loses the game.

154742.description:
In Video Game High School, players take on the role of students from an alternative school where their classwork is all about preparing for careers as professional video gamers. Each student has unique player powers that they will use to their advantage as they select from a limited allotment of actions to train their gaming skills, take on challengers, and set high scores in various video games. The goal of the game is to climb the player ranks and become the top ranked gamer at VGHS.

NOTE: No prior knowledge of the webseries is needed to play the game.
154742.name: Video Game High School
boardgameexpansion: Video Game High School: Freddie Wong

154743.name: Finde den Freund
154743.description:
Objective: gain most victory points finding matching cards
- acting by turns -
there are 64 cards with matching qualities regarding: colour (4), animal (4), mood (4); additionally on each card you see a mathematical symbols like (2 arrow; arrow 3..)
8 cards are placed in a circle, hidden. Active player turns one and follows shown symbol e.g. 3 steps to the right, turns appropiate card and follows shown symbol again. If all cards are turned or ending in a vicius cycle player may take up to 3 cards putting them on her/his hand. Matching cards (animal/mood/colour) can be formed and dropped (victory points depending on number and matching items). Handlimit: 5 cards

154745.name: Rampage Puzzle Attack
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
154745.description:
The game is based on the Rampage characters. At the beginning of the game, the three characters from the original game, George, Lizzie and Ralph, are available, but more characters who appeared in other games of the series can be unlocked through the Rescue mode

The basic idea is that the player drops two colored blocks at a time to the playfield. The blocks then merge into contiguous areas. When the player drops a flashing "detoblock" of matching color to touch the area, the entire area is removed and scored. This can lead to chains and combos, which lead to higher scores.
The game includes a single- and two-player modes. The following modes are available in the single-player mode:
Clear mode - this includes various areas that need to be cleared to advance to the next level.
Puzzle mode - Similar to Clear mode, but there are only a limited number of blocks this time.
Rescue mode - A cage is added to the bottom of the playfield, and the idea is to remove the blocks on top of it before the time runs out.
Marathon mode - There's no set conditions of win, the game continues until it's impossible to keep going.
Two-player modes include Rescue mode (similar to the one-player mode), Score mode (competition for higher score) and Attack mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rampage Puzzle Attack", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154746.name: Bauherr
154746.description:
Der Bauherr is a strategy and construction board game. In order to achieve the main goal of building a city, you must buy buildings by winning auctions, build and maintain them. Apart from plenty of buildings to construct, there are also orders to process and events to take care of. Der Bauherr was conceived for two players but also works with more.

Nicht komerzielles Stadt-Aufbauspiel mit Strategieelementen.
Building / City simulation.

154747.name: Mittelalterliche Ritter
154747.description:
Objective: gain as many cards (victory points) as possible
- acting simultaneously -
each player gets a card: 'fully equipped knight'
gamemaster draws a hidden card from the deck (incomplete knights);
first player who names the missing part gets the card

154748.description:
Mythic Battles: Expansion 2 - Tribute of Blood includes new and powerful Mercenaries Units who may now join your army. You may now enroll Chimera, Hydra, Myrmidons, a catapult or brigands. Players can reinforce their armies while facing off against one another in six new epic scenarios.

Mythic Battles: Expansion 2 - Tribute of Blood also includes Achilles and Atalanta, two new Heroes with otherworldly powers to add to your deck to get bonuses.
154748.name: Mythic Battles: Expansion 2 – Tribute of Blood

154749.name: Carmen Sandiego Word Detective
154749.description:
Carmen Sandiego Word Detective is a game in the Carmen Sandiego franchise which was released in 1997. This game is intended to teach language arts for kids age 8-14. LearningVillage describes Word Detective as a "spy adventure". The title is very similar in format to Carmen Sandiego Math Detective, which was released a year later.

In the game Carmen Sandiego has invented a machine called the Babble-On Machine, and the user, playing the role of Agent 13, has to thwart her plans and free all the other agents which have been captured by Carmen.

The game comes with many bonus features, including "3 levels of difficulty, an electronic dictionary, 10,000 spelling words, customizable spelling lists, 50 spelling rules and an on-screen progress reports."

Gameplay:

The intro starts off with Agent 12 (Ann Tickwitee), who has found Carmen's hideout. Under the orders of Chase Devineaux (The Chief-type character), she creeps inside, only to find herself trapped and start to babble. Carmen enters and explains that she has invented a "Babble On" machine that turns speech into gibberish.

When the player begins, they are Agent 13, who has just been called into the case. The player must "free all twelve agents in order to stop her grand plan to achieve world illiteracy". They do this by going to enemy hideouts and solving language problems in order to get passwords which allow then to retrieve keys which they use on the machine to free agents.

Source: Wikipedia, "Carmen Sandiego Word Detective", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154750.name: Carmen Sandiego Math Detective
154750.description:
Carmen Sandiego Math Detective is a 1998 Carmen Sandeigo video game. It is similar in structure to Carmen Sandiego Word Detective, which was released a year before.

Michael Lipman was lead animation layout artist, character Designer, and animator for the game.

Gameplay:

The plot of the game is that Carmen Sandiego has shrunk famous landmarks into crystals using the Quantum Crystalizer machine, which the player must restore to their full size. The player travels to different hideouts, and plays maths-related minigames such as Atom Smasher, Crimewave Sensor, and Microchip Decoder, which when completed provide passwords. Once the player has enough passwords, they can get keys which allow then to free crystals from the machine. The game comes with "over 400 word problems, a strategy guide, glossary of math terms and progress reports". There are 3 levels of difficulty.

Source: Wikipedia, "Carmen Sandiego Math Detective", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154751.description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns/use 2 dice -
Simple 'Roll and Move' game; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid

Notes:
Due to confusing background advertising game is also listed as
'Das grosse Autorennen': inside the lid you can find a third title: 'Die Kurve'; likely published during 1950's
154751.name: Das grosse Autorennspiel

154752.name: Gildenbrief 16-21
rpgissuearticle: Das TsaiChen-Tal - Zweiter und letzter Teil
Korrekturen zu MIDGARD, Das Fantasy Rollenspiel 3. Ausgabe. Frühjahr 1989
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
154752.description:
user summary

A collection of issues 16 to 21 of Gildenbrief magazine.

154753.name: Ice Cold Ice Hockey
154753.description:
Ice Cold Ice Hockey is a thinking-man's card game that has been designed to simulate all the excitement of professional ice hockey. An action deck of 64 cards, three rink-cards and comprehensive yet easy-to-understand rules comprise the complete game (although you'll need to supply a small token, disc or coin). The cards serve multiple purposes, including passing, skating, shooting, defense, shot-blocking and goaltending. Experienced players will be able to complete a game in about an hour.

Note that this is NOT just a “draw and play cards (or a take-that!) game.” Card combinations and good decisions are key in ICIH. You’ll always want to keep an Inside Shot card in your hand, for example, in the hope of pairing it up with a Pass or Skate card that leads to an Inside Shot. (Your brain will be working on all cylinders during the entire game, and your play will improve over time as you learn to watch for the appearance of important cards.)

I call the above a “set-up.” Three and even four-card set-ups are possible, and over time you’ll learn what they are. You can also bluff a bit; for example, if you have a surplus of Offensive Zone (OZ) Skate or Pass cards but no Inside Shot card, you can play an OZ card which allows the play of a defensive card to tease one out of your opponent’s hand.

ICIH features realistic shots on goal, scoring and game play. Sometimes you’ll effortlessly set up end-to-end plays while at other times you’ll only be able to dump the puck out of your own defensive zone. You’ll shoot from the point and, after some effort, from close-in. On defense, sometimes you’ll be able to challenge the puck-carrier and sometimes you won’t. Sometimes you’ll have to risk a penalty to stop an opponent’s scoring chance. Loose pucks, blocked shots, breakaways, fighting, momentum, penalties, super-saves – they’re all here in Ice Cold Ice Hockey!

154754.name: Rot, gelb oder grün
154754.description:
Objective: be the first completing your player board with coloured chips & learning colours.

- Acting by turns -

Choose a playerboard and throw a coloured d6; you may take a corresponding chip and place it upon an appropriate space of your board. If the die shows 'white': chip is up to your choice, with 'black' you must return a chip of your choice.

Player with a complete player-board wins.

154755.name: If I Ran the Zoo...Con
154755.description: If I Ran the Zoo...Con: The Smofcon 3 game is a simulation of organizing a WorldCon event. Players form committees, perform actions, make decisions, and follow through on those decisions through the bidding, planning, and convention phases of the process using a choose-your-own-adventure style situation resolution book. By conserving goodwill, utilizing people, and balancing finances one committee will produce the most successful event and be crowned WonderCon, while the others will bear the label BlunderCon.

154756.name: Ultimate Assassin 2
154756.description:
Be an Ultimate Assassin in this exciting game. Your mission is to assassinate the target then escape from the place. You have two special abilities; speed and invisibility. You should be calm and think fast to succeed.

Source: The Publisher Website.

154757.description:
From the publisher's website

It’s every Gunship for itself in our highly-destructive Free-for-All Mode!

Form temporary truces as you must guard from attack from more than one direction. But remember: Only ONE side will be left standing when the debris field clears!

Set includes one Green Carrier Board and one White Carrier Board. Also includes two standard 12-sided dice.
154757.name: Gunship: Green and White Carriers

154759.name: Ultimate Assassin
154759.description:
Kill your targets without being noticed by enemies. Be an ultimate assassin!

Source: The Publisher Website.

154760.name: Raketen-Wettfahrt
154760.description:
Each player gets 4 rockets and a Sputnik. The moves are determined by a color die. The starting spaces are the colored dots on the rockets at the edge of the game board. The Sputnik is the last piece to start. It circles the Earth till the last rocket has arrived on its destination space. The first Player, who gets his rockets on the 4 destination spaces near his starting spaces and lands the Sputnik on earth in the center of the board, wins the game. A rocket, which lands on a space with another rocket on it, capture this rocket and releases it only when it reaches its destination space.

This game was published 1957 (launch of Sputnik 1) or up to a few years later.

154761.name: Crime Stopper
154761.description:
From the game intro:

You are Al Clubs, Grandson of a famous detective of another era and another suit. You come from a long line of private investigators, And you seem to have inherited your family's ability to sniff out trouble. In fact, It almost seems to sniff you out. Maybe it's your cologne.

Crime stopper is a text adventure game with a two word parser.

154762.name: Rise of the West
154762.description:
Rise of the West is a video game version of the boardgame Empires of the Middle Ages for two to six players which simulates grand strategy and diplomacy in the Middle Ages.

Each player controls an empire composed of areas, each of which is rated for wealth, religion, language and population. The talents of each empire's current ruler are represented by numerical ratings for warfare, administration, and diplomacy. The object of the game is essentially to grow an empire in terms of wealth, geography and stability.

Source: Wikipedia, "Empires of the Middle Ages", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154763.name: Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? 3 New Carmen Adventure
154763.description:
Mais où se Cache Carmen Sandiego? Mystère au Bout du Monde (known as Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? 3 - New Carmen Adventure in English) is a French Carmen Sandiego game released on February 18, 2009. It was published by Mindscape and developed by Strass Productions. It is a point-and-click adventure aimed at ages 8 to 12. It follows ACME detectives Julia and Adam in a world-wide hunt across 10 countries for stolen world treasures. It is published by Mindscape, France, and developed by Paris-based Strass Productions. It was released for the Nintendo DS.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mais où se Cache Carmen Sandiego? Mystère au Bout du Monde", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154764.name: Treasures of the Deep
154764.description:
From the back of the jewelcase box:

As Jack Runyan, ex-Navy Seal, your global treasure trek takes you from the shark-infested Great barrier Reef to the foreboding abyss known as the Mariana Trench. Utilize the latest high-tech weaponry and submersibles as you explore sunken ships, battle sea monsters and thwart terrorists.

154765.name: Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? Treasures of Knowledge
154765.description:
Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? Treasures of Knowledge (aka Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? and Carmen Sandiego Treasures of Knowledge) is a game in the Carmen Sandiego franchise, released in 2001 (despite some sources saying it was released in 2002). Despite the title, this game seems to have little do with the previous Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? titles, even abandoning the long-standing formula of the series. Instead, the game seems to be based on the structure of the newest version of Where in Time is Carmen Sandiego?, which The Learning Company retitled Carmen Sandiego's Great Chase Through Time.

The protagonists of the game are Carmen's former partner Julia "Jules" Argent, an experienced ACME detective, and new recruit Shadow Hawkins, who is gadget-happy and rather arrogant. Jules and Shadow's personalities frequently bounce off each over the course of the game, similar to how Zack and Ivy were paired up in "Where on Earth is Carmen Sandiego?", and that they had trouble with each other, but in the end, they both got along. The Chief explains that she has paired them together because she believes their personalities complement each other and indeed by the end of the game they appear to have gained some respect for each other's methods (or have at least agreed to disagree.)

At the start of the game, Carmen steals a rare Franco-Italian edition of The Travels of Marco Polo (which conveniently has the title written on the cover in English) and, as the game progresses, she goes on to steal a Māori wood carving, Incan Quipus and other seemingly random items. The goal of each of the first seven missions is to recover one item, which Carmen has hidden in a puzzle somewhere in the world. The user can only unlock this puzzle by collecting items or clues from other countries, often having to solve other puzzles first. At the end of each case, the item is found and it is announced that Carmen has stolen something else.

As the game continues, Jules and Shadow find that each object Carmen has stolen seems to be tied to a mysterious Portuguese explorer, a lost city with a great treasure and a strange "wheel" design. On the eighth and final case, Jules and Shadow track down the lost city itself. Once inside the city, however, they find Carmen sitting inside a chamber filled with priceless treasures. Carmen suggests that she may be planning to lock Jules and Shadow away in the city, but Jules insists that Carmen would not do such a thing. Shadow captures Carmen by grabbing her wrist with a grapple launcher, but she inexplicably escapes through the use of a smoke bomb. Jules suggests that Carmen wanted them to find the treasure all along so that it could be put in a museum, but Shadow remains convinced that Carmen is simply a bad person. Whatever Carmen's true motivations were is left to the user's imagination.

Treasures of Knowledge plays its storyline more seriously than previous games, eliminating such series staples as pun-filled word play, gag names, and humorously impossible thefts. However, humor is still included in much of Jules and Shadow's dialogue. Though V.I.L.E. agents are often mentioned, only a few anonymous henchmen appear in the game. Although the animation is also more realistic, the game liberally uses limited animation techniques. Shadow's database is the same database as the one in the 1996 version of the game and location music from the 1996 version is briefly played whenever the user arrives in a new country although it quickly fades away. Jordan, which was not included in the 1996 game, is an exception to this. In Shadow's database, Jordan replaces Saudi Arabia.

Source: Wikipedia, "Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego? Treasures of Knowledge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154766.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In many ways, the Z-95 Headhunter was the precursor to the X-wing. Though the Z-95 was later outclassed by the X-wing in most respects, it could perform a tighter turn and was cheap, durable, and reliable enough that the Rebel Alliance continued to make use of it throughout the Galactic Civil War, most commonly in close air support roles.

The Z-95 Headhunter enters the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game as the Rebel starfighter with the lowest squad point cost. None of the four ship cards in the Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack weigh in at more than nineteen squad points, and at just twelve points, the Bandit Squadron Pilot ties the Imperial's Academy Pilot as the starfighter with the game's lowest point cost value. However, the Z-95 Headhunter isn't designed to fly like a TIE fighter; it comes, instead, with the focus and target lock actions, as well as the ability to load and fire a missile. Accordingly, the Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack comes with two missile upgrades, the Assault Missiles and the deadly Ion Pulse Missiles.

Altogether, the Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack includes one Z-95 miniature, four ship cards, five upgrade cards, one maneuver dial, and all the tokens necessary to bring your Z-95 Headhunter to battle!
154766.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Z-95 Headhunter Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set

154767.description:
Game description from the publisher:

When it was first released shortly before the Battle of Endor, the TIE defender was perhaps the most technologically advanced starfighter in the galaxy. It improved upon the design of the TIE fighter by adding shields, a hyperdrive, and more powerful weaponry.

In Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game, the TIE defender is a lethal starfighter that features three attack, three agility, three hull, and three shields. Imperial players can further load it up with both cannon and missile upgrades, and because only the Empire's most elite pilots were allowed to fly the TIE defender during the Galatic Civil War, both of the unique pilots among the expansion’s four ship cards come with the elite talent upgrade.

The TIE Defender Expansion Pack introduces one TIE defender miniature, four ship cards, one maneuver dial, all the tokens you need, and five upgrade cards, which include a pair of elite talents certain to make your elite TIE defender pilot a truly fearsome predator throughout the game's fast-paced dogfights.
154767.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Defender Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set

154768.description:
Game description from the publisher:

When it was designed, the E-wing was intended to match or exceed the performance of the X-wing in every respect, and the E-Wing Expansion Pack for the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game introduces a starfighter that combines the best of the X-wing's firepower and durability with the A-wing's speed and maneuverability.

Furthermore, the E-wing's advanced technology is reflected in the fact that it can equip both system and astromech upgrades alongside a complement of torpedoes. The partnership of these upgrades permit some interesting, new combinations, and the E-wing may open some wildly creative squad builds. For example, by partnering R7-T1 with Advanced Sensors on a ship piloted by someone like Etahn A'baht, who is capable of using "Push the Limit" (included in the A-Wing Expansion Pack and Imperial Aces), you could perform three actions before you reveal your maneuver. And if that maneuver is green, Etahn A'baht would even end his Activation phase without a stress token!

With its E-wing miniature, four ship cards, five upgrade cards, maneuver dial, and tokens, the E-Wing Expansion Pack comes with everything you need to pursue entirely new tactics in your X-Wing battles!
154768.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – E-Wing Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set

154769.description:
Game description from the publisher:

By adding a stygium crystal cloaking device to a modified V38 assault fighter that came equipped with both deflector shields and a hyperdrive, the developers of the TIE phantom created one of the most menacing starfighters in the galaxy!

The TIE Phantom Expansion Pack brings this fearsome fighter to life in the Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game with new rules for cloaking that allow it to slip off opponents' sensors in the middle of battle. Imperial players will be able to further customize their phantoms with system and crew upgrades, so the Rebellion will never know what to expect.

The TIE Phantom Expansion Pack includes one TIE phantom miniature, four ship cards, five upgrades, one maneuver dial, reference cards for its new rules, and all the tokens you need to bring your TIE phantom to battle!
154769.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Phantom Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set

boardgamehonor: 2013 Guldbrikken Best Children's Game Nominee
154770.name: Tombalo
154770.description:
Tombalo is a balancing game. Together, the players are building a dam from sticks and logs. Each player starts with a supply of sticks and logs.

Each turn, a player will draw a card, which shows how many sticks he may add to the dam. He then has to place these sticks on top of the existing construction (or on top of the starting pillars, if there is nothing yet). If any sticks drop in to the water, the player gets new sticks from the supply.

The first player to get rid of all his sticks wins the game.

154771.name: Divinity
154771.description:
Divinity is a cooperative turn-based card game for 2 to 4 people, in which each player assumes the role of a deity trying to forge the universe as it is eaten away by powerful disasters of mysterious origin. As players work together, the universe either succumbs to the calamities or is saved by the grace of the gods!

The goal of the players in Divinity is to accumulate points by creating various objects in their galaxies. The divine cards are used by players to achieve their goal, while calamity cards are force-played through to game, undermining the players' efforts. Depth is created through the interaction of all these cards, creating new situations every game and requiring players to consider card abilities carefully in order to master the game.

When the game ends, players add all their points together to judge the fate of all they've built. Players must play wisely, as both divine and calamity cards can cause the game to end. Control of both points and when the game ends is critical to success.

Divinity is inspired by cooperative games heavy in strategy and planning, as well as light and chaotic party games. It's made to be quick to set up, easy to learn, but full of endless wonder. Why not try being a god today?

154772.description:
2-6 Players build up defenses and toss Zambies around as weapons. Turn all your enemies into Zambie Bosses and be the last Player alive to win.

A simple game, quick to learn and quick to play. The more people you can get to play the more crazy the game becomes. The game revolves around drawing cards that consist of Zambies and Defenses. You use these cards to turn the game in your favor by blocking incoming Zambies, building up your enemies Zambies pools and once maxed, turning them into Zambies Bosses.

The Game doesn't end when you lose, Oh no, there is much more. When your Zambie pool is maxed out at 15, you collect the Zambies in your pool, and now you get to throw those Zambies at other players.

Zambies is a fast paced card game and can take 5 - 30 minutes to play.
154772.name: Zambies: The Card Game

154774.name: Carmen Sandiego's ThinkQuick Challenge
154774.description:
Carmen Sandiego's ThinkQuick Challenge (sometimes referred to as Carmen Sandiego's Think Quick Challenge is an educational and entertaining computer game for kids ages 8–12 (although PC Mag suggests it is suitable for ages 10 and up). The title, which is a part of the Carmen Sandiego franchise, was released by The Learning Company on June 1, 1999. It can be played by up to 4 players, and runs on the Mohawk engine.

Plot

The player(s) are on a mission to stop Carmen Sandiego and her Master Thieves (consisting of Count Hypno, Dr. Depth, Dr. Ima LeZaarde, Jane Reaction (one of the original thieves in the 1997 version of Where in Time is Carmen Sandiego?) Otto "Gnash" Readmore, and Snarla Swing) from taking over the modern world. At the beginning of each mission, Chase Devineaux, the ACME Detective Agency's top agent will brief you on the suspect and which essential concept to survival in the modern world has been stolen by the Knowledge Robots (KnowBots) working for that suspect. KnowBots will try to stop the ACME agent from disabling them (or delay the destruction and automatic surrender of 1/2 of the code that reveals the suspect's location) by challenging them to several Jeopardy- like rounds of questions in the subject areas of History, Geography, Math, Crime Scene, which is similar to a memory game, English, Life Science, Physical Science, or Art and Music. If the player(s)answer correctly, they gain a certain amount of Knowledge Points dependent on the type of question being asked (For example, Multipick questions are worth 950 Knowledge Points and Rapid Fire Sort questions are worth 200 Knowledge Points apiece). If they get a question incorrect, they lose one point of Capture Energy, which is essential to the capture of the Master Thief.

There are three difficulty levels. Level One's questions are intended for the 4th and 5th grade student; Each player starts each mission with 30 capture Energy points. On Level Two, the questions are intended for 5th and 6th grade students; Each player starts their mission with 25 Capture Energy points. On Level three, the questions are for 6th grade students and above; Each player starts with 20 Capture Energy points. Overall, the object of the game is to get past Carmen's Know-Bots and correctly answer the questions to capture the current thief out on the loose. Some players will meet Carmen on the way, but she will not be captured until the very end of the game, which according to fans, is about 300 missions. The player has 30 distinctive missions to complete in order to complete the storyline.

ThinkQuick presents information in a game show format, and "test...students' ability to recall information previously taught". Players receive points for correct answers. Original content can be created for the game via the custom content creator (and for example inputted by teachers for school quizzes).

Multiplayer

Carmen Sandiego's ThinkQuick Challenge offers a multiplayer option in which the player can play with friends. There are two types of multiplayer: The players can play cooperatively or competitively. If the player choose to play cooperatively, they will work in teams and score the same amount of points if one player answers a question correctly. Whereas in competition, it's vice versa. The player with the most capture energy will have the opportunity to capture the thief, but if there is a tie in capture energy, the player with the most Knowledge Points will have the opportunity to capture the thief.

Source: Wikipedia, "Carmen Sandiego's Think Quick Challenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154775.name: Octodad: Dadliest Catch
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Best Comedy Game of the Year Nominee
154775.description:
Octodad: Dadliest Catch is the sequel to the splash hit, Octodad! This time, our cephaloprotagonist has gotten himself in a bind between his wife’s mounting mistrust, and a disastrous trip to the local aquarium! Are you dad enough to control the titular octopus father as he strives to hide his nautical nature from his family while keeping his tangled tentacles intact?

Source: The Game Website.

154776.name: RPG Review (Issue 22 - Dec 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Moieties of the Pig Island Orcs
Movie Review: Thor The Dark World
The Dungeon as Narrative and Simulation
Tunnels and Trolls Bestiary: Troll Special
Updating Tunnels and Trolls Character Generation

154777.name: Micro Quest
154777.description:
Micro Quest is an adventure micro-game consisting of only 30 high quality cards and 30 custom meeples. Players will utilize the Market Economy and Quest Cards to gather the kings forces of highly trained Knights, Thieves, Clerics, and Mages.

Your land is under siege and the king has commanded you and your compatriots to acquire, train, and supply battle ready troops to support the war effort.

In Micro Quest, players compete for the king's favor (aka: victory points) by managing, training, and paying tribute with troops to support the king's army.
The game play consists of 3 phases:

1. Market Phase - players vie for control over the available units.

2. Quest Phase - players train their units by completing epic quests, activating powerful skills, and obtaining glory.

3. Tribute Phase - players compete in an all-out battle for the 'King's Favor' and must be careful managing units in order to pay proper tribute to the king.

154778.description:
Welcome to AssassinCon, the annual convention where assassins meet to show off tools and skills and decide who is the best in the world! This year the contenders have decided to take it out of the judge's hands. Do you have what it takes?

AssassinCon uses an interesting hidden movement mechanism to capture the atmosphere of an event in which anybody could be out to get you. A player knows who their assassin is in real life, but not who they are playing in the game. They move around by secretly playing movement cards that are all shuffled together before being read and played.

The goal is to catch your target while evading your assassin. Points are scored for successfully assassinating a player, identifying your would-be killer, or scaring players into making mistakes as a ghost from beyond the grave, so even dead players are still in on the action!

Can you safely navigate the treacherous crowds of the most dangerous AssassinCon yet?
154778.name: AssassinCon
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 049 – I, Geek talks BGG.Con 2016!

154779.name: Question Quest: The Language Card Game
154779.description:
From publisher:

Welcome to the world of Question Quest! It's a wondrous place where language learning happens amid adventure, excitement, and strategic gameplay.

Each turn players compete for Crystal Points by asking and answering questions in conversational English. But things get wild when Special Cards like "What's your answer?" and "Tell me more!" enter the mix! The Crystal Rush is on!

Question Quest is a card game for 2-6 players, playable in 20-40 minutes.

Players take turns asking each other questions in English. Players score points by answering questions correctly or by asking questions that their opponents answer incorrectly.

The game ends when the last card is drawn or at the end of the allotted time. The player with the most points is the winner!

154780.name: Rondje Groningen
154780.description:
480 questions (96 cards) are used to become more familiar with the state/region/territory you are living in (Groningen). A die determines the category (5):
language & history; culture & cohabitation; economy & corporate activities; nature, territory & environment; sport & tourism. If you can give a correct answer you get the card; on the back of each card you see a sixth of a map; with a bit of luck you can find matching ones - winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.

154781.name: Rondje Friesland
154781.description:
480 questions are used to become more familiar with the state/region/territory you are living in (Friesland). A die determines the category (5):
language & history; culture & cohabitation; economy & corporate activities; nature, territory & environment; sport & tourism. If you can give a correct answer you get the cart; on the back of each cart you see a sixth of a map; with a bit of luck you can find matching ones - winner is the first to gather all six parts of the map.

154782.name: Where there is a Heart
154782.description:
Designer summary

The match making industry one Valentine IV is in disarray. Can the lasers find the cause, and set things right. And will they save love in process, or destroy it?

Where there is a Heart is a short Ashen Stars scenario, originally written for RPGGeek's Holiday Adventure Contest 2014.

154783.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Potsdam
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Potsdam. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
154783.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Potsdam

154784.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Wolfsburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Wolfsburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
154784.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Wolfsburg

154785.description:
The Nebula is a cosmic cloud of dust and gas. The stars in the sector are too young to support colonizable planets, yet for brave explorers the Nebula offers powerful Discoveries and a perfect hiding place...

The expansion contains two Nebula hexes, one Ancient Monolith Discovery Tile and one Development / Rare Technology Board (on the back side of the rules sheet).

The two Nebula hexes are shuffled with the other Sector hexes before building the Middle and Outer Sector stacks. The Discovery Tile is shuffled with the other Discovery Tiles.

The Nebula is divided into three subsectors, connected by Wormholes. For Move, Explore and Influence rules purposes, each subsector functions exactly like a normal hex. When you Explore and place the Nebula, place one Discovery tile in each subsector with an Discovery symbol and one Ancient Ship in the subsector with the Ancient symbol. You cannot place an Influence Disc on the hex. The Discovery Tiles can only be claimed by having a Ship in the subsector at the end of the Combat Phase. If you place a Discovery Tile benefit in the Nebula, you must place it in the subsector where it was found.

When you collect the Ancient Monolith tile, place it in the hex where you found it. It functions just like a normal Monolith.
154785.name: Eclipse: Nebula

154786.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Lüneburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Lüneburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
154786.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Lüneburg

154787.name: Segelfliegerspiel
154787.description:
Objective: be the first to pass finish line
learn more about flying a glider

- moving by turns/simple 'Roll and Move' game -

Meeples are moved according the die roll;
ending on a red space (20x) follow instructions..

154788.name: Lepelstronten: Het Bordspel
154788.description:
Lepelstronten: Het Bordspel is the board game developed for the 8th anniversary of gaming club Stobbeldeen.

Using dice, players try to move their pawn to a central target as soon as possible. As soon as one of the players succeeds, the target moves, forcing the other players to change direction and try to reach the new location. During the first phase of the game, users can, instead of rolling the dice, choose to buy cards, which can be used during the 2nd phase to move faster or block other players.

The player who doesn't reach the target in time will be penalized. After a predefined number of rounds, the player who has the least penalty wins the game.

154789.name: Barbarians of Porphyra
154789.description:
From publisher blurb:

To be a barbarian is both a personal choice and a cultural one, sometimes given and sometimes thrust upon an individual being. It is an epithet and a badge of pride, for those who live by the indulgence of primal rage see themselves as the pure fighters, not the trained soldiers of wasteful campaigns of old men in comfortable chairs.... The direction and application of barbaric rage and skills is usually based on environment and upbringing, as intertwined as a wizard’s books in a quiet tower is to the arcane arts. The isolated lands of Porphyra, especially those in place before The Calling, are the holdfasts of barbaric culture, both human and nonhuman, for
they feel the heart of the beleaguered planet itself, and it might just be Porphrya’s rage they are in tune with, after all.

Barbarians of Porphyra includes:

New racial archetypes for the barbarian.
New feats and rage powers.
An archetype for the runereaper.
New barbarian hordes and equipment.

154790.name: Dwarves
154790.description:
From publisher blurb:

The NPC classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game are an often overlooked treasure for gamemasters. This collection of 100 block stats features all 5 NPC classes (Adept, Aristocrat, Commoner, Expert, and Warrior), level 1 through 20, along with suggestions on variants, ideas for using them in your own game, and even how to use them as player character classes for a "lite" game!

154791.name: Elves
154791.description:
From publisher blurb:

The NPC classes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game are an often overlooked treasure for gamemasters. This collection of 100 block stats features all 5 NPC classes (Adept, Aristocrat, Commoner, Expert, and Warrior), level 1 through 20, along with suggestions on variants, ideas for using them in your own game, and even how to use them as player character classes for a "lite" game!

154792.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume II
154792.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the game of Pathfinder, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume II, and its successors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 14 mythic spells, from antipathy to bear’s endurance, mass. With the spells in this book you can use mythic astral projection to not only visit other planes, but also visit the minds of other sentient creatures. Or you can use mythic atonement to instill a pseudo-conscience in the target, making it difficult for him to remain his current alignment, even if he is unwilling. Try a mythic banishment that prevents the banished creature from returning for a certain amount of time, or expend your bear’s endurance early to achieve an automatic natural 20 on a single Constitution-based roll, among lots of other exciting spells. Don’t wait: get your hands on the latest mythic spells now.

154793.name: Abyssal
154793.description:
From publisher blurb:

The eighth volume in our Mythic Monsters series, Mythic Monsters: Abyssal brings you a dozen and one Abyssal abominations from the deepest reaches of those infinite layers, where demons rightly fear to tread. Here you will find the eldest and fatherless qlippoth, the proto-demons spawned when the universe was young and that set in motion the devouring awfulness that is the Abyss itself. You will find also the demodands, godless mockeries forged by the cruelest titans, thwarted in their ascension to true divinity and raging against the heavens through their fiendish creations. Still other prowlers and predators of the plane of chaos and evil roam here, numbering twelve in all and updated for the mythic rules, and when we say updated we mean complete stat blocks, yes, but more than that every creature of chaos and emissary of evil has its own unique and exciting new mythic abilities, from a mythic baregara's terrifying challenge and beheading grapple to the faith-stealing strike and where is your god now abilities of a mythic noble slimy demodand!

This product includes mythic versions of all three types of demodands and five qlippoth, along with planar predators like the baregara and bebilith alongside deviant monstrosities that carry the tainted corruption of the Abyss with them into the material plane, like the terrifying kakuen-taka, covering CRs from 3 to 23. In addition to a dozen existing otherworldly foes, Mythic Monsters: Abyssal also contains an extensive in-character introduction to the warring and fiend-races of the Abyss in general, and the binding of the terrifying qlippoth in particular, with special runestone rituals for the binding of each. To top it all off, Mythic Monsters: Abyssal introduces an entirely new 13th mythic monster, the demon-devouring vermicious horror that is the ylrygoi qlippoth, ever on the hunt for the hosts in which to implant its shoggti tadpoles with its waving throng of stinger-necks akin in appearance to a headless hydra, if its heads were made of deadly scorpion's tails!

154794.description:
Hastings 1066AD is a wargame simulation of the battle fought in 1066AD to determine the future King of England. One player plays the Norman forces under William the Bastard, while the other plays the Saxon forces under King Harold.

Each turn simulates one hour of time, and each unit represents 300-350 infantrymen or Norman knights. One hex is about 50 meters across.

Contents:

One 11x17” hard-mounted game map
One sheet of 88 5/8” game counters
Two six-sided die
Rulebook
154794.name: Hastings 1066AD

154795.name: The First Battle of the Marne, 1914 AD
154795.description:
The First Battle of the Marne, 1914 AD is an operational level game.
This September battle changed the course of the war. One player (or team) controls the Allies (France and Britain), while the other controls Germany.

Contains:

11x17" hard-mounted map
Playing pieces
Rulebook
Player Aid Card

154796.name: Under the Knife: The Grafter, a Tinker Prestige Class
154796.description:
From publisher blurb:

"You'll be a whole new you!"

Go Under the Knife with the grafter, the latest prestige class for the tinker base class! Tinkers have made Super Mega Ultra Mechas, have made musical bands of their automatons, conquered the air and the sea, have controlled both the dead and the manufactured at once, and have constructed ridiculous weapons only they can use. Still, tinkers have always been an island unto themselves, a party of mechanical minions within a larger party.

That ends here.

The grafter prestige class (a 5-level prestige class) finally makes inventions a community thing. Equipped with a grafting pool, the grafter first learns how to install inventions on his own body. With sufficient practice, he learns how to install inventions on any corporeal creature that will sit still and let him. Helicopter rotors for the entire party? Check. Speed-enhancing augmentations for the monk? Check. A setup for an automatically reloading crossbow on top of the wizard's head? Double check. The grafting options are expanded beyond the already-copious inventions offered to the tinker base class through the advent of implants. Implants are treated just like any other invention with the caveat that they only function as grafts and cannot be installed on automatons.

Though it may not be as flashy as other tinker releases, the grafter will find its way into many a build. It's modular and powerful in its simplicity, making it a tool that will expand the number of tinker builds available by an amount that its page count normally wouldn't suggest.

154797.name: The Fat Lady Sings: 14 Compositions for the Maestro Base Class
154797.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's not over until the fat lady sings!

The maestro base class is effectively the bookish bard, an individual who studies music to the point that he can compose his own custom scores from various intros, outros, and melodies in his Composition Book. At release, the class had enough compositions to get by, but, as wizard-like classes go, they can always use more. This modest expansion seeks to add some variety to the maestro's development as a character by providing a selection of compositions with feat requirements.

The maestro primarily works in five schools of magic: conjuration, divination, enchantment, evocation, and illusion. This product features three compositions that require the Spell Focus feat for each of these schools of magic, save enchantment, which has two to balance the fact that the base class already has a composition requiring Spell Focus (enchantment). These compositions offer highly specialized uses, including fate-fixing through rerolls, buffers against hostile enchantments, party-wide mirror image effects, and the conjuration of a fat lady who stuns everything near her. Applied to the base compositions present in the maestro base class, this collection of the situational and the downright powerful will be sure to get the creative juices flowing once more.

154798.name: Kassai Rider
154798.description:
From publisher blurb:

One arrow alone can be easily broken, but many arrows are indestructable.

With the Kassai Rider, a new 20-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord (and other old-school fantasy role-playing games) you'll rain swift brutality down upon your enemy with terrible speed. Mounted upon a swift steed and wielding your bow with deadly accuracy, there's no foe you can't face and all adversaries will be left trembling in your wake!

154799.name: Knight
154799.description:
From publisher blurb:

And Thus I Dub Thee...
