Adventure hook for use with this product.

Train Heist: The group is either hired to protect the train or to steal from the train carrying valuable resources such as gold, silver, or other precious minerals. If the group is guarding the train, they are likely holed up with the train crew in the caboose trying to defend against the bandits. If they are trying to rob the train, they need to reach it first. In a steampunk setting the heist includes steam cars built for offroading or steam trams that can be used on the rails to catch up to the caboose. Or perhaps steam copters to fly to the top of the train. In a Wild West setting, they are gonna have to ambush the train the old fashioned way, riding up to it with horses and jumping onto the train cars or rail sabotage to make sure the train stops.

154885.name: Tremor
154885.description:
From publisher blurb:

TREMOR!

Armed with devastating weapons, Tremor, the shakedown scoundrel, is ready to take on any heroes that cross his path! Shaking up any combat he enters, he'll leave his foes shattered into pieces.

154886.name: Heartbreaker
154886.description:
From publisher blurb:

HEARTBREAKER!

Just in time for Valentine's Day comes the master assassin, Heartbreaker. One part cold-blooded killer, one part shattered Casanova, he's an international contract-killer looking to fulfill his latest contract: the heroes in your campaign! Will they defeat him? Or are they just another target?

154887.name: Zombieskin
154887.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zombieskin is a story roleplaying game about mutants and zombies — Damned and Scabs — waging an epic battle at the end of the world. As society crumbles around them, the scab horde grows stronger each day. Characters are the Damned, not so average people with genetic mutations, using their gifts to fight the zombie hordes and keep the world from ending. But each use of their mutant power brings them one step closer to becoming zombies themselves…

Now. As the final days of the war tick away, the first child born without a mutation must be protected from the scabs and brought to safety.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

154888.name: George's Children
154888.description:
From publisher blurb:

George's Children is a story roleplaying game about children in a post-apocolyptic world devoid of adults. In this version of George’s Children, the characters are aged 7 to 12 on a journey to find the mysterious figure, known only as George. They have just one day to wake, find food, and journey to George before the sun sets. Perhaps George isn’t real? Perhaps he’s a legend? Or perhaps he can tell them where all of the adults have gone?

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

154889.name: Toasted or Roasted
154889.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Toasted or Roasted is an offensive/defensive game in which players try to be the first to start their campfire and toast three marshmallows — but watch out for Roasty because he will burn the marshmallows to a crisp!

To get your fire lit, you must collect a fire starter card, which you can then lay on your firewood disk to start the flames flickering. The next challenge will be securing a marshmallow for your roasting stick. Take turns flipping cards until you get a raw marshmallow. Finally, be on the lookout for a toasted card to add to your stack to complete one of the three toasted marshmallows you need to make. But be careful because if your opponents turn over a rain, wind or roasted card, they can put out your fire or burn your marshmallow and you'll have to begin again!

154890.description: Click & Crack is a simultaneous action selection game in which the players control two penguins each, walking around on a big ice floe. Each turn, players either move or cause cracks in the floe. The player who causes a crack so that the floe breaks in two parts gains as many points as the size of the smaller floe. The game ends when one player has seven points or more, or the main floe has reached a certain size.
154890.name: Click & Crack

154891.name: They Came from the Stars
154891.description:
From "... and the sky full of dust" blog:

The adventure itself is loosely based on an adventure my dad ran for us back when I was a young lad. We fought the Greenies, got sick from radiation poisoning, and won in the end (I think we drove them off). I made them the focus of a story I wrote, where they were greatly enhanced by battle armour with missiles and machine guns, killing off characters al over the place. Happy memories :)

154892.description: Loonacy is a rapid fire card game in which players race to be the first to empty their hand by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the open piles in front of them. The number of piles varies depending on the number of players, and if players ever reach a moment in which no one can play, everyone draws a card and it adds it to their hand at the same time, then the game play resumes.
154892.name: Loonacy
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 130: Back In Box
The Party Gamecast Reviews - Loonacy

154893.description:
The word game Wurf & Wort challenges you to think in syllables instead of letters.

On a turn, a category card is revealed, e.g., "on the beach" or "at the airport"; each card shows a points multiplier and a few dice icons. Someone rolls these dice, then everyone tries to be the first to come up with a word that fits the category and falls within the restriction of the dice (as not all dice will be rolled each time). The number on the syllable die indicates how many syllables the word must be; the forbidden die shows which letter cannot be used in the answer; and the two letter dice show a letter that should be used in the answer along with a point value.

Whoever comes up with a valid word first scores the sum of the letter values for each appropriate letter in her answer times the points multiplier on the card, up to a maximum of ten points. If the answerer chooses an inappropriate word — or a majority of players vote down the word for being off-category — the answerer loses three points. After all 25 category cards have been played, the player with the most points wins.
154893.name: Wurf & Wort

154895.description:
On entering the wizard's academy, the new apprentices swore a solemn vow to learn the ways of magic, protect the institution, and uphold its values. Unfortunately most of them have failed to learn any significant magic in their first year. Susie coasts by on her natural talents, Malkar would sooner sell his soul for power than read a book, Nyvetta has forgone that option along with opposable thumbs upon accidentally turning herself into a bear, Flitter is only here to steal magic items to sell on the black market, and Bramblethrone spends too long talking to trees to get anything done. As a group of students, they could not be worse.

Wizard's Academy is a co-operative game of magical experimentation for 1-6 players. In each game, the players select a scenario, such as summoning and binding a demon to steal its powers, defending the academy against an attack by an army of Imps, or (in the most difficult scenario) facing an academy inspector whom they must impress with their mastery of magic.

Players move around the academy collecting glyphs in order to cast spells. At first, the effects of the spells are unknown, but as the players try new things, the students gain the power to manipulate the academy, the creatures within it, and the fates themselves – ideally achieving their goals before the monsters and elements that they've accidentally summoned reduce the building to smoking rubble.
154895.name: Wizard's Academy
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 115 - Wizard’s Academy
1P 117 - Pandemic: Legacy
Boardcast News 4.3.2015 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
TRCP Launch Episode 2

154896.description:
The game of smarm, swag, and popped collars.

You are a freshman in college. You want to get into the most Bro fraternity on campus, but how can you show up the other pledges?

Popped collars bro. Be the first person to sport a killer ten layered pop collars, and they'll have to let you into the fraternity over the other posers!

When you start the game draw five cards. On your turn you draw one card. You then can play one card, or attack once per turn.

You have slots for two hands, one chest, one head and your feet, and can accessorize each of those items. That's 5 slots. You can not wear more accessories then you have slots, unless a card says otherwise.

You win the game when you have 10 popped collars worn.
154896.name: Yo' Bro

154897.name: Speed Freaks
154897.description:
Speed Freaks, released as Speed Punks in North America, is a kart racing video game for the PlayStation for up to four players (with a multi-tap).

The game involves racing around a variety of tracks while using several weapons including speed-ups, missiles and slime. The game has several single and multiplayer modes. During the game, players take control of one of nine characters and drive karts around tracks with various themes.

Source: Wikipedia, "Speed Freaks", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154898.name: The Nemesis Crisis
154898.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ad Infinitum Adventures presents an adventure for ICONS: Superpowered Roleplaying, usable as a stand-alone "Event Comic" or as part of the Rise of the Phalanx storyline, usable with the characters from Hero Pack 5.

Called to invesitgate a mysterious phenomenon, the heroes are whisked away from Earth to the the otherworldly Equinox, where the Cosmic Justicar pits them against their greatest foes, with the fate of Earth's metahuman population at stake!

Can the heroes overcome the challenges to prove themselves worthy in THE NEMSIS CRISIS?

154899.name: Battle Beast
videogameversion: North American Windows Big Software Value edition
154899.description:
Battle Beast is a side-scrolling fighting game released for the PC in 1995. In the style of Mortal Kombat or Street Fighter, a player can play against another human opponent or computer-controlled opponents in different levels using hand-to-hand combat, special moves and weapons to defeat each other. A distinct feature in Battle Beast is the use of animals, which can transform into large robotic machines to battle one another. Players can select 6 different animals, which start off as cutesy-looking pets but all transform into large robots to fight, each animal has its own specific special combat techniques, weapons and attributes.

Players can fight on various levels in the single player mode as they advance through "sewers" to reach the final boss, a large Toad (Toadman), and complete the game. There are also several mini-games mixed in between the fights such as races through mazes and secret bonus rooms to collect upgrades and weapons.

Multiplayer can be direct human to human combat, with two players battling each other on the same computer or across a LAN network or the internet. Players can also battle in a cooperative mode together, where two players can progress through the single player levels together.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Beast", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154900.name: Pets vs Monsters
154900.description:
Pets vs Monsters is a free-to-play online game for kids. In this light-hearted and fun fantasy setting, our world and others are being invaded by monsters – and they’re trying to take over!

Kids team up with their friends and favorite pets to battle the monster invasion.

Together they can explore exciting and mysterious worlds, collect armor to customize their character and find new and powerful pets.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
154901.description:
You've been selected for the most rigorous, cutthroat reality competition on TV! As a contestant, you’ll compete in challenges and work with and against the other competitors for a shot at fame and fortune. You won’t win if you go it alone, but don’t get too friendly! You’ll have to do a bit of backstabbing to emerge victorious.

The Fittest features fierce social play and shifting alliances. Players will have to evaluate a challenge each round and convince other players to work with them in order to best the challenge for variable rewards. The player who has best managed their alliances and achieved the best rewards at the end of the game will be the victor.

The Fittest was chosen as a runner-up in the Dice Hate Me 54-Card Challenge - a contest that asked designers to create a game with 54 cards with minimal components. The Fittest was chosen as one of the best out of a pool of over 100 game entries.
154901.name: The Fittest
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 3: Iterating a Design
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
154902.description:
Diner is a fast-paced game about waiters in a friendly competition to make the most money in tips. Take orders for the tables in your section, gather the plates to fill those orders, and serve your tables, and do it as quickly as possible while showing up the other players.

Diner features a pseudo-real time mechanic that has players passing action tokens whenever they take an action; if a player does not have a token, that player can't take an action. At times, action tokens may accumulate in front of a player, allowing them to take multiple actions at once.

Diner is the winner of the Dice Hate Me Games 54-Card Challenge - a contest that challenged designers to create a game using only 54 cards and very minimal components. It was selected as winner among over 100 participants.

Additional description from interview posted at: http://boardgamegeek.com/blogpost/28649/chris-kirkman-on-his...

Diner puts players in the shoes of someone serving patrons at a greasy spoon. The goal is to earn the most in tips by gathering plates of various types from the kitchen and then serving them to a table of patrons in your section demanding certain orders. The real magic of the game is in the pseudo-real time action system.

When you want to take an action - say, seat a table in your section - you have to have an action token in front of you. When you perform the action you pass the token to the player next to you. Sometimes those action tokens can pile up allowing you to do multiple things at once. Other times you’re urging the other players to hurry up a bit so you can serve your tables.

It’s a very madcap, social experience, with lots of table talk. With the action tokens, though, it’s not total chaos like many real-time games - there is a lot of control worked into the mechanics. It’s a brilliant design, and one that will appeal to many gamers whether they like real-time games or not. Guaranteed.
154902.name: Diner
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
The 2 Minute Review - Episode One

154903.name: Shōgi
154903.description:
An LPS bonus mini-game, Shōgi is an expansion for Operation Cartwheel.

The game covers Japanese and American carrier operations in late 1943, and includes new counters, rules, displays, and a new map.

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
154904.description: Wanderlust abounds in Sheboygan! The Easy Breezy Travel Agency is here to accommodate, and you’re one of their top agents. You are competing over eager customers in order to send them on trips to fabulous destinations (and earn a commission, of course). The longer you wait to book a trip the more you can charge the desperate travellers, but if you’re not careful a fellow agent might just book that trip ahead of you. Whether it’s by land, rail, or air, Easy Breezy Travel Agency is a game of timing, opportunity, and happy vacationers.
154904.name: Easy Breezy Travel Agency
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 1 - Our Introduction Into Gaming
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
154905.description: In Brew Crafters: The Travel Card Game, you've opened your own brewery and are competing with other brewers in town to be named the Brew Crafter of your city. You'll build your brewery by installing equipment and hiring workers, and then get to work brewing your beer! The player that earns the most reputation as the city's best brewer will win! Brew Crafters: The Travel Card Game is based on the Dice Hate Me Games release Brew Crafters.
154905.name: Brew Crafters: The Travel Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Strange Assembly 175 - Welcome to the Cthulhu Brew

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
154906.description:
In Isle of Trains, players are train operators, building trains with the right mix of freight cars needed to complete delivery contracts before your opponents.

Cards are used in multiple ways: they can be built as train cars or buildings supporting your train line, used as currency to pay the cost of building those new train cars and buildings, or used as cargo to load on available train cars.

When loading cargo on an opponent’s train, players receive an immediate benefit or action, but they are also giving their opponent the cargo they just might need to be able to complete a delivery contract and score big!

Balancing the need to upgrade your train, take advantage of benefits from loading other players' trains, and complete delivery contracts first is the key to being the most successful train operator on the Isle of Trains!
154906.name: Isle of Trains
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ95: Isle of Trains (2014) Seth Jaffee + Dan Keltner
Episode 16 : BGGcon 2015 Recap - Codenames - Favor of the Pharoah - Time Stories
Episode 2 - Leveling the Playing Feld
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Episodio 15 – Seguimos jugando
Episodio 15 – Seguimos jugando

154907.description:
Excerpt from the back:

This issue of Captain's Log includes the following exciting features:

The First Round, an exciting science fiction story by Stephen Kacarides. A related scenario is included and may be played by four players.

The Life and Times of Deth O'Kay, a special group of scenarios.

Ground Combat is portrayed in a stylized set of game rules. Several scenarios are provided.

Major Fleet Battles are presented in the scenarios Titan and the Unicorn and A Time to Live; A Time to Die.

Over Twenty New Scenarios are presented in this issue.
154907.name: Captain's Log #3
boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #1: Fighters and Shuttles

154908.description:
Excerpt from the back:

This issue of Captain's Log includes the following features:

Where Wisdom Fails: The exciting story of the first combat test of the Hydran Hellbore.

A Mini-Campaign: Based on the story. A series of five scenarios.

The Tholian TK-5 Destroyer: A Commander's SSD.

The Orion OK-6 BattleCruiser: A Commander's SSD.

The Consolidated Addenda: A compendium of three years of rules updates, expansions, and changes.

The SFB Rules Cross-Index: Provides quick access to the rules system.

Term Papers: The latest tactics from top starship commanders.

New Scenarios
154908.name: Captain's Log #4
boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #1: Fighters and Shuttles
Star Fleet Battles Supplement #3: Fast Patrol Ships
Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #1
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #2
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #3
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #4
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #5
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #6
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #7
Star Fleet Battles: Commanders SSD Book #8

154909.name: Nightmare Circus
videogameversion: North American Genesis Sega Channel edition
154909.description:
User Summary

Side-scrolling/vertically scrolling action/beat 'em up game set in a carnival/circus environment with four levels: the rollercoaster, the maze, the big wheel and the big top.

154910.description:
Live project now on Kickstarter!!

> Darklight-Kickstarter <

Darklight: Memento Mori brings old-school dungeon crawler action with original dark-gothic settings and deep strategic combat.

Four Accursed (the players) bound together by a twist of fate, must fight their way though randomly generated dungeons to find lost treasure and acquire the souls of those they slay to extend their own life and use it as currency to survive in a world left in ruins by the coming of demons.

Each player will take on the role of one of the four dark heroes which must survive and find their way to the Quest Room in order to complete a specific objective and win their current mission. Many things will try to stop them from terrifying and grotesque monsters to unexpected traps or events lurking secretly in the dungeons.

For those wishing to expand their playing experience, the game continues through hazardous journeys where the Accursed must resolve player driven decisions which can prove fatal when the wrong choice is made. If they were to survive the journey, they would find a settlement where they can gather their strength, buy new equipment or participate in the many activities available such as jousting while building their own reputation to improve their standing with the locals.

Darklight: Memento Mori is a living experience within a dark, mysterious world full of deception and secrets.
154910.name: Darklight: Memento Mori
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 014 – Dead of Winter vs Robinson Crusoe
Episode 22: Kemet Review - Ta-Seti Review

154912.name: The Victory of Arminius: Teutoburg Forest, IX AD
154912.description:
The Victory of Arminius is a tactical game for two players that depicts one of the most famous battles of the Roman Empire, the action that stopped the empire’s expansion into Germany in A.D. 9, when three Roman Legions were destroyed in fighting with the German tribes. The players take sides, one commanding the Germans, the other the Romans.

Each hex is about fifty meters across, and game turns represent about forty-five minutes of fighting. Counters in the game represent “units,” the combat formations of both sides, and markers used to denote various game functions or conditions. Unlike many other simulations, The Victory of Arminius has no “Combat Results Table.” Rather, the battle function is adjudicated entirely with dice.

Contains:

Mounted, full-color Board
Rules
~140 counters
Aid Card

154913.description:
The fourteenth game in Turning Point Simulations' coverage of Mitchell and Creasy' Twenty Decisive Battles of the World.

The game covers the campaign leading up to the critical battle at Valmy, where the French won their first victory of the French Revolutionary Wars, opening the door for all that was to come.

Game contains:

11x17" full-color mounted map board
Diecut, full-color counters
Rulebook
Aid card
154913.name: The Valmy Campaign: The Revolution Saved, 1792AD

154914.description: Pawn Voyage is a race game where family and friends battle each other for their place in paradise. Stranded and alone in a life raft, players must stay afloat while attempting to get all their pawns to paradise before anyone else does. It won't be easy though, the other players will be doing all they can to Trade Places with you, Challenge you for your position or sending you flying across the board to a random location. You will find extra help along the way with Additional Turns, Shortcuts and a Mega Roll to get you into paradise even quicker.
154914.name: Pawn Voyage

154915.name: Evolve
videogamehonor: 2014 Game Critics Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2014 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Winner
2014 Game Critics Best of Show Winner
2014 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Winner
2014 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Gamescom Best Action Game of the Year Winner
2014 Gamescom Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
2014 Gamescom Best of Gamescom Winner
2014 Gamescom Best PC Game of the Year Winner
2014 Gamescom Best Playstation Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Gamescom Best Xbox Game of the Year Winner
2014 The Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee
154915.description:
Evolve will be a co-operative game where four hunter players attempt to defeat an alien monster controlled by another player. Both the hunters and the monsters can use unique abilities during the game. The monster player can kill wild life and other smaller monsters and evolve by going into a cocoon stage. The game will take place in a large jungle, where players can take shelter. There are also various power ups that can be taken by both hunters and monsters players.

Source: Wikipedia, "Evolve (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154916.name: XS Junior League Soccer
154916.description:
User Summary

Junior League Soccer is street soccer game for the Sony Playstation.

154917.name: Sailboat Championship 2013
154917.description:
SAILBOAT CHAMPIONSHIP 2013

We have the pleasure to invite you to participate in a sea racing experience like never before! It does not matter if you are a novice or adept sailor - Sailboat Championship is the best sailing game you can find! Participate in thrilling regattas and fast paced races, upgrade and unlock new boats, complete amazing and action-filled courses and collect all gold awards! Become the ultimate master of Sailboat Championship - the only true and addicting sailing simulation with unique gameplay for your Mac[, iOS, and Android] device.

Source: The Developer Website.

154918.name: Piano Master Christmas Special
154918.description:
Learn to play piano in an easy and funny way!

Piano Master is a music game, just follow the notes on the screen and you will be able to play many famous songs.

The songs have various difficulty levels, so the game can be played by children, novice piano students or experienced musicians.

Christmas Special
This is a special version of "Piano Master" dedicated to the World's Most Popular Christmas Songs and Carols. It includes 28 songs.

Source: The Developer Website.

154920.name: Piano Master National Anthems
154920.description:
Learn to play piano in an easy and funny way!

Piano Master is a music game, just follow the notes on the screen and you will be able to play many famous songs.

The songs have various difficulty levels, so the game can be played by children, novice piano students or experienced musicians.

National Anthems Special
This is a special version of "Piano Master", dedicated to the national anthems of the countries of the world. It includes 32 songs.

Source: The Developer Website.

154921.name: Piano Master Mozart Special
154921.description:
Learn to play piano in an easy and funny way!

Piano Master is a music game, just follow the notes on the screen and you will be able to play many famous songs.

The songs have various difficulty levels, so the game can be played by children, novice piano students or experienced musicians.

Piano Master Mozart Special
This is a special version of "Piano Master", dedicated to Mozart, that includes 21 of it's best piano compositions. It is not for beginners, all the songs are from normal to high difficulty.

Song list:
Sonata 8 (3 movements)
Sonata 10 (3 movements)
Sonata 11 Alla Turca (4 movements)
Sonata 12 (3 movements)
Sonata 13 (3 movements)
Sonata 16 Sonata Facile (3 movements)
Sonata 17 (3 movements)

Source: The Developer Website.

154922.name: Piano Master Chopin Special
154922.description:
Learn to play piano in an easy and funny way!

Piano Master is a music game, just follow the notes on the screen and you will be able to play many famous songs.

The songs have various difficulty levels, so the game can be played by children, novice piano students or experienced musicians.

Piano Master Chopin Special
This is a special version of "Piano Master", dedicated to Chopin, that includes 49 of it's best piano compositions. It is not for beginners, all the songs are from high to very high difficulty.

Song list:
Opera 7 (2 Mazurkas)
Opera 9 (1 Nocturne)Opera 10 (3 Etudes)
Opera 18 (Grande Valse Brillante)
Opera 23 (1 Ballade)
Opera 25 (6 Etudes)
Opera 27 (2 Nocturnes)
Opera 28 (24 Preludes)
Opera 31 (1 scherzo)
Opera 33 (2 Mazurkas)
Opera 35 (Piano sonata n.2)

Source: The Developer Website.

154923.name: Piano Master Beethoven Special
154923.description:
Learn to play piano in an easy and funny way!

Piano Master is a music game, just follow the notes on the screen and you will be able to play many famous songs.

The songs have various difficulty levels, so the game can be played by children, novice piano students or experienced musicians.

Piano Master Beethoven Special
This is a special version of "Piano Master", dedicated to Beethoven, that includes 27 of it's best piano compositions. It is not for beginners, all the songs are from normal to high difficulty.

Song list:
Sonata 5 (3 movements)
Sonata 8 Patetique (3 movements)
Sonata 11 (4 movements)
Sonata 14 Moonlight (3 movements)
Sonata 21 Waldstein (3 movements)
Sonata 23 Appassionata (3 movements)
Sonata 26 Les Adieux (3 movements)
For Elise
Sonata 29 Hammerklavier (4 movements)

Source: The Developer Website.

154924.name: Piano Master
154924.description:
Piano Master is a piano app for iPhone, iPad, android smartphones and tablets. It is designed as an arcade game, so it is very funny to play, but it can also be used as a learning instrument by piano students.

Piano Master is a music game, just follow the notes on the screen and you will be able to play many famous songs.

The game includes songs composed by Beethoven, Chopin, Bach and other famous classical music authors, as well as popular melodies like Merry Christmas, Happy Birthday To You, and many others!

The songs have various difficulty levels, so the game can be played by children, novice piano students or experienced musicians.

Source: The Developer Website.

154925.name: Championship Bass
154925.description:
User Summary

Championship Bass is fishing simulator released for Playstation, Windows, and Playstation Network.

154926.name: Micro Miners
154926.description:
Use your finger as a pickaxe, dig tunnels and guide the Micro Miners to the Gold, Silver and Coal deposits. Where's my lemmings?

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary

Micro Miners are lemming-like creatures that can dig through coal, gold, and silver deposits, but must be guided by the player deeper into the earth towards these deposits as the screen scrolls ever upward. Missing a deposit generates a penalty and certain miners will die upon encountering the wrong deposit of ore.

154927.name: GURPS Social Engineering: Pulling Rank
154927.description:
From the Publisher:

Show Them Who's Boss

While the Rank advantage looks wonderful on paper, it doesn't do much as written. To make an organization work for you, you need to buy it as a Patron. Even then, the benefits of a Patron are only slightly better defined than those of Rank – and unlike Rank, Patrons come in just four levels (6 or less through 15 or less), making it hard to represent fine-grained hierarchies where seniority brings "pull." Wouldn't it be nice to get the best of all worlds . . . not to mention more detail?

Such is the mission of GURPS Social Engineering: Pulling Rank. It expands on the Pulling Rank rules first seen in GURPS Action 1: Heroes, adds the more nuanced reading of Rank found in GURPS Social Engineering, and delivers a system that lets you know the odds of using your Rank to summon a specific kind of assistance. Highlights include:


Instructions for replacing organizational Patrons with Rank and associated advantages and Duties.
Rules for using Rank to make things happen, taking into account story, situation, and personal abilities.
Examples of specific aid – from invitations to the ball, through being sprung from prison, to fire support.
Thoughts on Rank in the campaign: what kinds exist, how many levels PCs can buy, what it means for NPCs, supernatural varieties, and more.


If you've always craved a campaign where the heroes work within the system, seeking believable social position rather than bigger and badder combat abilities, then GURPS Social Engineering: Pulling Rank is for you. Nothing makes promotion quite as attractive as knowing that it brings real power!

154928.name: Dirt Jockey
154928.description:
From the back of the North American PS1 box:

Bulldozers, Cranes, Dump Trucks. Gentlemen Start Your Engines.

Operate heavy construction equipment that looks, feels, sounds, and runs just like the real thing - from rumbling hydraulic excavators and hard-working dump trucks to wheel loaders, bulldozers and high-reaching crane. Earn your construction license and start building.

Learn to drive a crane, bulldozer, hydraulic excavator, wheel loader and dump truck - just like the ones at real construction sites.

Test your skill in Equipment Rodeo, operating the excavator in 4 events: Treasure Hunt, Mountain Maker, Overdrive, and Spin Touch.

In Practice Mode, pick a machine and build a huge mountain of dirt or tear one down. You can even spell out your name in the mud.

154929.name: Rush Bros.
154929.description:
Rush Bros is a pulse-pounding, music infused Platform Racing Game that features a single player and a competitive multiplayer either split-screen local or online between two simultaneous racers. Rush through over 40 unique levels jam-packed with puzzles, obstacles and power-ups in a race to the finish line where the victor can literally crush his competition.

Features:


45+ music-infused, platform racing tracks jam-packed with puzzles, obstacles and power-ups
Features musical tracks by Infected Mushroom, Xilent, Dead Day Revolution, Black Parrot, Animal Music plus winners of the Beat Battle and more!
Special themed stages including ReverbNation, Infected Mushroom, Dead Day Revolution, Xilent, Side FX, and the list keeps growing
Reactive level design where the music you play directly affects the movement of traps, obstacles and backgrounds
Single Player Mode allows players to learn the levels and race against their own Ghost Data
Two Player Local Split-Screen Action
Online Multiplayer that supports Cross-Platform competition between PC and Mac gamers
Rock out to your own MP3 or OGG music library
Remix your gameplay by turning on "Fast Forward" to speed everything up or "Survival Mode" where it is one hit and game over


Two DJ's Enter, One DJ Leaves!

Source: The Developer Website.

154930.name: 3rd Millennium Chess
154930.description:
"3rd Millennium Chess does for chess what Christopher Columbus did for the world." - Shannon Rene Gardner, designer

3rd Millennium Chess, AKA 3MChess, is a chess variant played on a wrap-around cylindrical 8 x 14 board. There are two other differences from conventional chess:

1. Each player begins with a row of eight pawns on each side of the home rank. Pawns move away from the home rank.

2. Each player also begins with four knights. A knight can share a square with an allied knight, and a knight can carry an allied knight.

154931.description:
The Witches Cauldron is a competitive abstract puzzle game where the players try to be the first one to complete 3 recipes in order to become the Witches Assistant.

The game is a brain burner as you are trying to get the best of the order in each turn thinking ahead the possible use of the other two visible orders for the next turns. Each player has 18 ingredients placed randomly on a grid of 3x6 that shapes their tableu. They also have 3 orders they can use to replace a common order they do not wish to use.

Each turn an order is to be used whether it is to rotate, push or switch ingredients. A recipe is completed when the ingredients are aligned as the recipe in the board shows.

Content:
- Main Board
- 1 set of 18 ingredients for the main recipe (to be placed in the main board)
- 3 sets of orders (3 of each to be used in the main board)
- 4 sets of ingredientes (18 per player)
- 3 backup orders per player (1 of each)
- guiding tokens and recipe complete tokens.


El Caldero de la Bruja es un juego competitivo abstracto con tintes de rompecabezas donde los jugadores intentaran ser los primeros en completar 3 recetas para poder convertirse en el Asistente de la Bruja.

El juego puede ser quemacoco ya que lo que se intenta es aprovechar al maximo la orden disponible cada turno y preveer el uso de las otras dos ordenes reveladas que seran usadas en los proximos turnos. Cada jugador tienen 18 ingredientes situados al azar en una grilla de 3x6 que formara su tableu. Tambien tienen a su disposición 3 ordenes con las que podrán reemplazar por única vez una orden comun que no deseen o no les sirva usar.

Cada turno una orden es usada ya sea para rotar, empujar o intercambiar ingredientes. Una receta será completada cuando los ingredientes sean alineados como muestra el tablero principal.

Contenido:
- Tablero Principal
- 1 set de 18 ingredientes para las recetas principales (que seran colocados en el tablero)
- 3 sets de ordenes (3 de cada una para ser usadas en el tablero)
- 4 sets de ingredientes (18 por jugador)
- 3 ordenes de reemplazo por jugador (1 de cada tipo)
- tokens de guia y de receta completada
154931.name: El Caldero de la Bruja

154932.name: Battle Chess II: Chinese Chess
154932.description:
Animated "Chinese Chess" for MS-DOS where mostly-humanoid characters make legal moves, often turn into other creatures upon attack, but always destroy their opponent in an interesting and/or entertaining manner.

From the Game Box:

"Cannons thunder, chariots race over grassy fields, and dragons hurl fireballs at opposing forces in the latest animated strategy game from Interplay Productions. Battle Chess II: Chinese Chess (TM), an ancient cousin to western chess, features stunning graphics, realistic sound effects, and more humorous animation than the original Battle Chess (TM). Watch as dragons toast hapless knights, counsellors flatten pawns with enormous mallets hidden in their robes, and cannons merrily blast away at opponents cowering behind other pieces.
With Battle Chess II: Chinese Chess, chess is no longer an abstract mental exercise. It is an entertainment that will prove the words of the famous Oriental Philosopher/Chef Kung Pao who said "War is fun!

Some of the many features included in Battle Chess II: Chinese Chess are:

A Strong Chinese Chess algorithm
2D & 3D viewing modes
Recommends best move
Multiple levels of difficulty
Play by Modem
Take back and replay moves
Show legal moves"

154934.description: Pentominoes was described by Solomon W. Golomb in a talk to the Harvard Mathematics Club in 1953, which was later published in American Mathematical Monthly and in Scientific American. Pentomino puzzles had been described before, but it was Golomb who coined the name and described a game for one to three players. Others have published their own variations, but the game described by Golomb consisted of an 8 x 8 grid of squares and a set of twelve pentominoes. Players take turns placing the pentominoes on the board, taking care not to overlap the pieces or to use a tile more than once. The last player to place a pentomino on the board wins the game.
154934.name: Pentominoes

154935.name: Book of Heroes Volume 1
154935.description:
From Publisher's product description:

Set of 30 fantasy character miniatures and 4 mounts, lovingly rendered in retro style pixel art. 86 miniatures including all available variants.

All miniatures feature both front and back art. Additionally, each character mini includes and additional mounted pose for use with the included mount miniatures.

Featuring the Miniature Selection Sheet: an interactive PDF which lets you choose which miniatures to print. This allows you to print only the miniatures you need, and also allows for the inclusion of variants of some miniatures.

154936.name: Deadly Dungeons Terrain Pack
154936.description:
From Publisher's product description:

Set of dungeon terrain, including:
1-8 inch dungeon walls
single and double doorways with hinged doors
single and double doorways without hinged doors
3D stairs
a sheet of textured flooring for cutting into tiles of combining into a larger play mat.
A selection of pits (normal, bottomless, spiked, and acid filled) available in 6 sizes each.

154937.name: Fearsome Forests Terrain Pack
154937.description:
From Publisher's product description:

Set of Fearsome Forest terrain, including:
Large (4 inch) trees, with and without platforms for placing miniatures (shown above with).
Treeline walls, like dungeon walls for a forest environment.
Bushes, with and without berries.
a sheet of textured forest flooring available with square, hex, or no grid.
The Tile Selection Sheet, for creating custom 4x4, 8x4, and 8x8 tiles.

154939.description:
MERCS: Recon - Counter Threat is a fully cooperative, stand-alone game set in the exciting MERCS world. Recon uses a modular setup that allows for a highly replayable experience.

Players are MERCS infiltrating an opposing MegaCon location. The MERCS team must fight through the tight corridors of the structure, capture and interrogate worker-citizen, find mission objectives, and breach and secure the package.

Recon utilizes MERCS well known dynamic, high-quality miniatures, an engaging fog-of-war mechanic with variable agent movement, escalating security forces, and a tension-filled end game through a unique breach and clear mechanic.
154939.name: MERCS: Recon – Counter Threat
boardgameexpansion: Mercs: Recon – Assistant to the Regional Manager
Mercs: Recon – Sgt. Pal & Roy McClane
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 11 - Pandemic Legacy with Nate Owens
GrogCast Season 1, The Lost Episode

154940.name: Empyrea
154940.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse, the Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. Human (and inhuman) civilizations in every conceivable variation populate these worlds, and on one shining world the race of man is ascending towards perfection.

Empyrea is an Earth-like paradise populated by the beautiful people of a technologically and genetically advanced Greco-Roman empire. Ruled by the deific Allfather, Empyrea is a place of superhuman Olympians, glorious competition, and hidden strife churning just below the surface. Gossamer Lords and Ladies beware - here, gods tread the ground and mere mortals aren't so mere.

154941.name: Destiny of the Sands, Part 3: Sanctum of the Sages
154941.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3–7.

Uncovering the secrets of a Jeweled Sage reveals that the others are in grave danger, and the PCs set off after notorious jewel thieves before the criminals can disappear with another priceless treasure. When the trail leads to the sages’ hidden sanctum deep within the Pillars of the Sun, the Pathfinders must draw upon both their own resourcefulness and the ancient historians’ power if they are to preserve a millennia-old organization and Osirion’s past.

“Sanctum of the Sages” is the final scenario in the three-part Destiny of the Sands campaign arc. It follows Pathfinder Society Scenario #5–12: Destiny of the Sands—Part 1: "A Bitter Bargain" and Pathfinder Society Scenario #5–15: Destiny of the Sands—Part 2: "Race to Seeker’s Folly." All three chapters are intended to be played in order.

Content in “Sanctum of the Sages” also contributes directly to the ongoing storyline of the Osirion faction.

Written by Pedro Coelho, RPG Superstar 2013 finalist.

154942.name: Fate of the Fiend
154942.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for level 7–11.

Years after the Pathfinder Society delved deep into the Jistkan ruins of Rachikan in western Cheliax, archaeological investigations continue to uncover ancient wonder. Reports recently ceased after scholars reported finding a sealed chamber believed to contain cadres of battle golems untouched since the Jistka Imperium’s collapse. The Pathfinder Society hopes to recover the golems for study and possible use in the Worldwound, but can its agents reach the sealed storeroom before the constructs fall into enemy hands? “Fate of the Fiend” is the spiritual sequel to “Fingerprints of the Fiend” and “Fury of the Fiend,” though the scenarios can be played in any order.

Content in “Fate of the Fiend” also contributes to the ongoing storyline of the Cheliax faction.

Written by Larry Wilhelm.

154943.name: jump-O
videogamehonor: 2015 Apple Design Awards Best Student Product of the Year Winner
154943.description:
User Summary

The game jump-O is a minimalist puzzle experience where the player moves a ball in an ambient with gravity, spikes, shots and other obstacles. The goal is to reach the portal and to collect stars.

It was listed as one of the best new games on the App Store in january, 2014.

The game received the Apple Design Awards in june, 2015 during the WWDC conference in San Francisco, USA. It was the first Apple Award earned by a brazilian team.

154944.name: Mass Destruction
154944.description:
Mass Destruction is a 1997 third-person action game developed by NMS Software Ltd. and published by ASC Games and BMG Interactive Entertainment. Released for MS-DOS, the Sega Saturn, and the PlayStation, the game puts players in control of a tank, and tasks them with destroying enemy forces. While some reviewers described the game as "simplistic" and "mindless", others found its stripped-down action enjoyable.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mass Destruction (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154945.description:
KEEP
At the end of your turn all monsters take 1 damage (including you), unless you pay 1 (energy).

From Zombie 15' Kickstarter campaign:

Our Fifth Sweetener - The Horde Promo Card for King of Tokyo

If you buy this card, it means that the Zombie Horde has been released on all of the giant monsters. Yes, those zombies are gnashing and gnawing at The King's hairy ankles, and scratching at Cyber Bunny's metallic legs. (Even the Kraken will be chewed on, believe it or not! He's chewy, and tastes fishy...)

Sure, the zombies are tiny compared to the giant monsters, but the zombies won't stop, and they are incredibly hungry! Someone told them how delicious Kaiju brains are, and now the zombie horde won't be satiated until they get to taste some. (That's an Alistair word, satiated. Blimey!)

Oh. Yeah. Sorry. I got carried away there.

So, you buy this card, and at the end of your turn, every turn, you either pay one energy cube, or the zombie horde bites every monster - including yours - and does one point of damage. If, however, you pay the energy cube, the zombies are mesmerized by the pretty glowing ball of energy, and forget to bite anybody - including you.

We think that this card is a lot of fun to play with, and will add a certain classiness to any King of Tokyo game. And, as we used to say back in my table top role-playing group, there is no situation so Dire! so Dangerous! so Desperate! that it can't be made just a little bit worse by the introduction of Flesh Eating Zombies!. (After a while, we shortened that sentence to FEZ!, and everybody knew what that meant!)
154945.name: King of Tokyo: The Horde Promo Card

154946.name: Die unglaubliche Robert Redshirt RPG Show
154946.description:
Publisher blurb

Im TV läuft immer das Gleiche? Dann dreh’ doch als TV-Crew deine eigene Show! Bring Schauspieler Robert Redshirt in möglichst gefährliche Situationen und rette ihn vor laufender Kamera, um die Einschaltquote in 25 Minuten Realzeit in die Höhe zu treiben.

Das 16-seitige, eigenständig spielbare A5-Heft enthält:

Szenario
vier Shows
NIP’AJIN Zero




Translation
Always the same on TV? Then shoot your own show as a TV crew! Bring actor Robert Redshirt in situations as dangerous as possible and save him in front of the camera to increase the audience rating during the 25 minute show (real time).

The 16-page, independently playable A5 booklet contains:

Scenario
four show formats
NIP’AJIN Zero

154947.name: Jigsaw Madness
154947.description:
User Summary

Jigsaw Madness is the digital version of jigsaw puzzles. The game includes 150 puzzles that can be completed.

154948.name: Pele-mele
154948.description:
Objective: be the first to complete your card by collecting/filling in matching coloured chips (4)
- acting by turns -
fill up the board: 4 x 6 coloured chips; put a chip on each corner
roll a 6d-coloured die and choose an appropriate starting position

Active player: rolls the die and chooses a direction; move until you reach an appropriate coloured space: take a chip (if there is any); if there is a smiling face: ask another player for a chip of his/her choice; sad face; give away a chip of your choice; joker: get a chip of your choice.

You loose if you have to take a fifth non-matching chip

154949.name: Out Of Dodge
154949.description: Publisher's Blurb: Oh my goodness did that ever go wrong. Shots were fired, mostly into Toad there, and the four of you got away with a bag containing less loot than you’d planned. A lot less. Now you are on the road, running for your lives and counting your blessings. You have your health (Toad does not have that), you have your friends (not friends), and you each have a still-warm piece tucked into your pants. You have eleven treasures to split four ways and that is not going to be pretty. Things are not looking up.

154950.name: Remodel
154950.description:
From the back of the book: At the start of a summer, four women get together to help remodel one of their homes. Each woman is near forty years old, and each has gone through a major life change recently. Some good, some bad, but for each of them it is a moment of taking stock and charting a new direction. The women are friends, and have the opportunity to be there for one another, in small ways and in large.

Each woman has reached the middle part of her life, not yet at menopause if that is something she will experience, but with a major portion of her life gone by now. Goals she has sought to reach have been attained, or passed her by. But this time brings new challenges, new joys and unexpected beginnings.

To tell this story you will play a role playing game. Four players take the roles of the women and the group will play out events. You’ll also play other characters in the womens' lives, exploring scenes earlier in their lives and throughout this summer of change.

154951.name: Wild West: Das neue Indianer und Cowboyspiel
154951.description:
This game is for 2 players (indians & cowboys) or 2 teams with up to 3 players. After the die is cast, the meeple can move to the next space of the rolled Color in any direction. The meeples start in their camp (colored triangle) and try to get into the enemy camp. Whenever 2 opposing meeples meet on the same space, they have to fight. The outcome is determined by the color die (red or blue). The loser has been captured, but can later be rescued by his mates. When a Player gets all his meeples into the enemy camp, or captures all enemies, he wins the game

The game was published in the 1940s or 1950s.

154952.name: Tales Of The Fisherman's Wife
154952.description:
Publisher's Blurb: It is Midsummer. On the morning three Fishermen leave for sea, their Wives mend their nets and spruce up their boats, and the Fishermen predict to their wives how their fishing trips will go. The couples exchange six words to weave a story to remember one another. While they are apart, the Fishermen and Wives catch the attention of otherworldly beings who try to seduce, possess, supplant, devour, or serve them. In turn, the Fishermen and Wives attempt to seduce, merge with, destroy, steal power from, or enslave the ghosts and demons who prey upon them. When the Fishermen and Wives reunite, some or all of them may not be what they seem.

Set in the Edo Period of Japanese folklore, this is a freeform larp where players are both the actors and audience. It is inspired by kabuki theatre, bunraku, ukiyo-e and shunga art (especially Hokusai's Dream of the Fisherman's Wife), and the game Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai.

154953.name: A Pocket Guide to American Freeform
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
154953.description:
Publisher's Blurb: This book looks at the emerging style of game design currently dubbed “American Freeform” and offers practical advice as well as historical information.

The introductory section provides some context for all the practical information that follow, and includes sections on the development of the style and terminology, as well as some titles to check out if American Freeform ends up being your thing.

Next comes a section on basic safety practices, with some explicit advice for players, facilitators, and designers. The subsequent guides assume you know your way around the basic safety practices.

The Quick and Dirty Guides are aimed at facilitators, players, and designers. They’re intended to get you running, playing, and writing scenarios as quickly as possible.

Designers will probably benefit from reading all three guides to understand how all three groups work together to make great scenes. Facilitators may want to also read the player guide to understand what this style of game can mean for players and how to work with that.

Finally, we end with some advanced tips and longer discussion about workshops, debriefs, and meta-techniques.

154954.name: One Last Job
154954.description: Publisher's Blurb: One Last Job is a game about playing desperate, unlucky individuals on one last job that’ll set them up for life. Every single facet of your character is defined by the other players during play as they insult you and load you up with scars, legends, and problems.

154955.name: Grammar Girl's Peeve Wars
154955.description:
Peeve Wars is a card game for 2 to 4 players and is appropriate for people of all ages.

The base deck contains 18 individual card designs mixed to make a 54-card playing deck. The goal of the game is to amass a peeve army you use to annoy your opponent(s) to death. You start with 3 cool points. Each time an opponent successfully annoys you, you lose a cool. When you completely lose your cool, you lose the game.

154957.description:
featuring "Birth of a Feud!" A new short story about Gorns and Romulans with accompanying scenario titled.."A Mission of Vital Importance".

New Ships including,Tholian Dreadnoughts makeovers..

Database,Battle group assault the Holdfast,Dek plans of the Federation Express,Hydran vs Lyran "Brothers of the Anarchist"..

Scenario's include.,Klingon D3's find the Romlans SITTING BIRDS,Gorn and Romulan ships find ONE CORNER OF HELL,

F&E Fans will find new rules and rulings, their own Proposals Board and Why articles, the Ship Information Table for the new ships, and lots of tactics.
154957.name: Captain's Log #29
boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

154958.name: The Crimson Crown
154958.description:
Released in 1985 under the title The Crimson Crown, on the same platforms as its predecessor. The game tasks the player with a quest to defeat a magical vampire with the assistance of Princess Sabrina (who is now a fledgling magician) and the heir to the throne, Prince Erik.

Source: Wikipedia, "Transylvania (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154959.description:
Damier géographique is French game from the WWI-era.

This game is a variation on the classical game of checkers, with a World War I theme.

2 teams of 2 players compete on a map of Europe that is overlaid with a checkerboard pattern. Each team has an equal number of pawns that represent armies. One team represents Germany and the Austrian Empire. The other team represents France, the UK, Russia and their allies.

The board is divided in a western and an eastern battle zone. At the beginning of the game, one player of each team plays in each zone. In the western zone, each player has 36 pieces. In the eastern zone each player has 24 pieces. The battles are played simultaneously, but separately (pawns cannot move from one battle zone to the other). When there is a victor in one zone, his remaining pieces go to his ally in the other zone.

The movement rules are those of the game of checkers. Each players moves in turn. Armies move one space diagonally and capture by jumping over an enemy pawn. Each country has one or two squares that are marked as fortresses. Armies promote to 'generals' when they can occupy an enemey fortress. A general moves as a king in checkers.

A battle in a zone is won by capturing all enemy pieces in that zone. The team that wins in both zones, or wins in one and draws in the other is the winner of the game.
154959.name: Damier géographique: les alliés

154960.name: XS Airboat Racing
154960.description:
User Summary

XS Airboat Racing is an arcade style racing game. The game has 10 different cartoony characters to use as your racer. There are three different game modes: arcade, tournament and time trial.

boardgamecompilation: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Handel & Wandel
Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Wissenschaft & Fortschritt
Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Zauberer & Drachen
154961.description:
This is a compilation of expansions for the Catan Card Game.

It contains:
- Handel & Wandel (Trade & Change)
- Wissenschaft & Fortschritt (Science & Progress)
- Zauberer & Drachen (Wizards & Dragons)

This game's subtitle (in German) reads "Themen-Sets für Das Kartenspiel für zwei Spieler"
154961.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Magier & Forscher
boardgamefamily: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Kartenspiel / Catan Card Game

154962.name: Mahjong Uranai Fortuna-Tsuki no Megami Tachi
154962.description:
User Summary

In Mahjong Uranai Fortuna-Tsuki no Megami Tachi you play the classic game of Mahjong against fortune tellers. If you win you can have your fortune told by a fortune teller. There are many different challenges to complete in this Mahjong video game.

154963.name: Infinity Blade III
videogamehonor: 2013 Spike (VGX) Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
154963.description:
The epic conclusion to the Infinity Blade saga! Siris and Isa have joined with the God King Raidriar in a desperate attempt to destroy the Worker of Secrets and his army of Deathless Titans. You are all that stands for humanity against an immortal god gone insane. Can you stop the Worker before it’s too late?

Source: The Game Website.

154964.description:
The fire has started -- You and the other rebels are here to see that it keeps burning all the way to The Capitol. Using different card combinations to score points, you must gather the most resources to best aid Katniss and the cause... But watch out! One of the other players may be a Capitol spy who will attempt to steal victory from you!

The Catching Fire Victor's Game is an easy-to-learn game of strategy and deduction as players look to maximize the cards that they play while also anticipating the strategies of the other players.
154964.name: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire – Victors Game

154965.name: 10 Pin: Champions Alley
154965.description:
From the back of the game box:

Roll into action with 10 Pin: Champions Alley, the easy to play bowling game that lets you play alone or with up to seven friends.
-Play alone or with friends.
-Choose from a range of exuberant characters.
-Pick from game types from quick practice to full tournament.
-Face colourful opponents each with their own strengths and weaknesses.
-For up to eight players (no extra controllers required)!

Combining ease of play and multi-player battles, 10 Pin: Champions Alley is a perfect party game for kids and adults alike, equally likely to be enjoyed after an evening out or on a rainy afternoon.

154966.description:
Each round, trade and negotiate with other players to collect 7 grams (7 cards) of the same strain of cannabis to obtain the highest amount of points possible. Once all 7 grams are in your hand, yell “Holdin’!” For that round you receive the number of points that strain is worth. If you are "Holdin'!" with the Piece Card, this doubles your points for that round. If you are left with the Seeds Card, this deducts 20 from your points that round. First player to reach 420 points total wins!

POT: The Card Game is a fast-paced, lively game full of frantic trading and bartering with other players. There are no "turns" in POT so you'll never have to wait your turn or forget who went last, etc. It’s hard to believe how fun this game really is, POT will turn any circle or party into a special one and with 52 poker sized cards, including the rules, tucked neatly into one attractive box, you can carry POT anywhere!
154966.name: POT: The Card Game

154967.name: GaiaSeed
154967.description:
Think you’ve played all the shmups out there? We doubt it. In fact, MonkeyPaw would like to bring you some that have never seen our shores. Gaia Seed is one of them. A rare find and great play.

aia Seed comes from the fabulous line of Japanese shoot ‘em ups and has the classic parallax scrolling that you could count on from the games of this era. The soundtrack is considered a great score and will set an aura that will get you grooving to the Gaia Seed.

For those who miss the days when the market supported a vast array of shooting splendor, GaiaSeed will satisfy you with its intensity and liquidity. One of the greatest shooters that never made it to Western markets, GaiaSeed is a smooth and silky display of algorhythmic perfection that always challenges but never frustrates.

GaiaSeed is a horizontally scrolling shooter from Techno Soleil. The game has solid control, precise bullet collision, and a simple powerup system. With six stages, it’s not the longest game on the block, but the massively scaling 2D backgrounds and variable difficulty make up for that. Think you’ve got the skills to beat a Japanese import?

But the real beauty of GaiaSeed lies in its subtlety. The technique and effects used will give shooter aficionados a work of art to go back to for multiple exposure. The soundtrack stands out for its techno/ambiance mood and is adds to the subliminal nature of the work. The effects and twists in the game will have you on your edge. Thoughtfully presented and wonderfully executed, GaiaSeed is a PSone gem. The game is very rare and can be found on online auction sites in the $150 range. Don’t miss this original Japanese hit!

Source: The Publisher Website.

154968.name: Le Carnival
154968.description:
From publisher blurb:

Le Carnival is a story roleplaying game about the human oddities (freaks) of a carnival during the Great Depression era. The Carnival travels the backroads of the Midwest farm belt and the Southern states, visiting towns far off the beaten trail. Characters are carnival freaks who hopelessly seek a degree of familiarity, clinging to the idea that somehow the Carnival is family. In fact, the “Brotherhood” of the Carnival is based only on who earns the most for the ringmaster, creating a twisted sense of meritocracy. The only true currency: fleecing the clueless rubes in the uneducated reaches of America.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

154969.name: Chō Aniki: Kyūkyoku Muteki Ginga Saikyō Otoko
154969.description:
Welcome to the bizarre world of Chō Aniki! This title was originally released in 1995, and was the only title in the long-running series to include digitized graphics for the majority of its objects and stages.
Chō Aniki: Kyūkyoku Muteki Ginga Saikyō Otoko is the third shooting game in the series, released the same year as a Chō Aniki fighting game. The title does not have a one-to-one translation, but could be called “Super Big Bro: The Strongest, Most Ultimate Invincible Man in the Milky Way.”

At long last, Western gamers can now enjoy one of the most controversial titles ever released in Japan. The legendary Cho Aniki will grab you by the dingle berries and pull you into its world of wacky fun. Long known for being a true Japanese “kuso-ge”, we present the game in its original Japanese splendor. No political correctness here. And no telling how strange a journey you’ll take. Hop on board and let the shooting begin.

Cho Aniki has always been a favorite of those with knowledge of the Japanese domestic game market. This classic icon of the shooter era created a special place as one of the most outrageous titles in the parody shooter legacy. Deemed too daring for Western markets, in reality, the game is a comic portrayal of over-the-top graphics in a time of over-abundance in the shooter genre.

As you blast your way through multitudes of erotic bodybuilders, spinning corpses and head holes, you’ll find humor and challenge in completing every emphatic level. The game consists of an unending spiral of the weird and wacky. Cho Aniki is tough and will challenge your shooting skills, but in return, you’ll get a constant flow of humor and irony that will make you laugh as you blast your way through.

This long-running series claims its first entry on the Japanese version of the TurboGrafx16, known as the PC Engine, and features muscle-bound manly men with holes in the tops of their heads. This 32-bit entry was originally released in 1995, and was the only title in the long-running series to include digitized graphics for the majority of its objects and stages. The game was also ported to the Sega Saturn.

Chō Aniki: Kyūkyoku Muteki Ginga Saikyō Otoko is the third shooting game in the series, released the same year as a Chō Aniki fighting game. The title does not have a one-to-one translation, but could be called “Super Big Bro: The Strongest, Most Ultimate Invincible Man in the Milky Way.”

While this is not the best game in the series, it is probably the most visually bizarre, and also sports an excellent soundtrack from a variety of composers, but notably longtime series stalwart Koji Hayama.

Chō Aniki: Kyūkyoku Muteki Ginga Saikyō Otoko is a game for those who appreciate an extreme challenge – don’t say we didn’t warn you!

Source: The Publisher Website.

154970.name: Moneta
154970.description: Called The Game of Moneta, or Money Makes Money. The box declares "By the author of Logomachy." The object of the game is to make the most money. Each of the 50 illustrated cards shows a coin; the denominations are: 1 cent, 2 cent, 3 cent, 5 cent, 10 cent, 20 cent, 25 cent, 50 cent, $1 (silver), $1 (gold), $2 1/2, $3, $5, and $10.

154971.name: Smashing Kitty
154971.description:
User Summary

Smashing Kitty is a mobile browser game for 1 player developed by .Gears Studios.

In this game, you control a Kitty that keeps jumping. You can move the animal either left or right with the goal of jumping over worms emerging from the ground or crawling left or right. You try to get the most points possible until time is over.

154972.name: RoboDev
154972.description:
RoboDev is a card based game in which players develop a robot by releasing Features. They earn points by fulfilling Contracts, building a well rounded robot and releasing the most Features.

With so many combinations of 60 unique Features, you'll create a different robot every game. Release Features in pace with your competitors to maximize your points based on which Contracts you're aiming to fulfill.

154973.description:
Cops & Robbers is a game about stealing loot from the bank (Deck of cards) While you steal loot you need to get away from the cops. The more loot that you steal the more cops you have chasing you. Use dirty tricks to help you get away from the cops and use other dirty tricks to get other caught and sent to the slammer. Make the fastest car that is going to help you escape but beware your other robbers, if your car is too shiny they may want to steal it themselves.

The game is played in turns with players selecting loot and other cards to ensure they have the best chance of getting away and pulling nasty tricks on others, but when a player is trying to get away other players can affect whether the player makes a clean getaway during their turn.

There are 3 decks in the game. The Cop deck, which shows how many cops are chasing you. The Loot deck which is basically your score in the game. The Robber deck which is the main deck that helps you get away, stop others getting away and lets you pull dirty tricks on others.
154973.name: Cops & Robbers

154974.name: RPG Maker
videogameversion: PlayStation The Best: RPGツクール3  Japanese Playstation Release
RPGツクール3  Japanese Playstation Release
154974.description:
User Summary

The third title in the RPG Maker series, and the first to be released outside of Japan. Aimed at players wanting to create their own RPGs, it includes an RPG creator, a sprite editor, and a complete sample game.

154976.description:
Silhouette Pocket is played with a deck of cards with silhouette images.

Two cards are drawn from the deck. The first player to come up with a word that matches both cards keeps them both, and two new cards are drawn. If there are a few cards where nobody can find an acceptable combination players are allowed to build combination with cards in their own stock.

When the deck is exhausted the player with the most cards wins.

Notes:
Can be combined with other 'Silhouette' editions;
Compact design
154976.name: Silhouette Pocket

154977.name: Geheimsache
154977.description: Successful spies rely on information from the well-informed circles of the underworld. All data can be important - if not immediately, then perhaps later. Therefore the secret agents have to connect to important informants and meet them regularly. So they need a secret weekly schedule. Which Agent shall obtain his information on Monday? Which informant is to visit on Tuesday? And on which day should the meeting with the agent codenamed PURPLE take place? The player, who can crack this puzzle first, will be the winner and has really earned to be named "Top Agent"!

154979.name: Burgen am Neckar
154979.description:
Objective: Conquer castles and fortresses along the Neckar river.

- acting/moving by turns -

Players roll the dice, move their pawn and try to conquer castles by finding correct answers for the questions about Knights and castles during the Middle Age.

First player occupied all castles wins the game (player elimination). Kids may play the game in a 'Roll & Move' modus without cards.

154980.description:
Each player has a set of 4 meeples that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the meeples around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by a die. All players may capture each others meeples. Captured meeples are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all meeples "home". Since the board is outlayed like an "8", the middle space is the most dangerous!

This game is a variant of Pachisi and was published in the 1930s or 1940s.
154980.name: Die verrückte Acht

154981.name: Ludusfidelis
154981.description: Ludusfidelis is inspired by artifacts from the Museu Municipal de Penafiel. It is a game for two played an a rectangular board with a 2 x 5 grid of squares. One row of squares is empty, the other marked with "coins." Players have three pieces each of their own color or shape, and take turns rolling a die to determine how to move their pieces around the board in a counter-clockwise direction. The six-sided die has the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 4, and 5 on it. The squares of the board are marked with roman numerals one through ten. The goal is for a player to land all of their pieces on the squares marked with a coin.

154982.name: Venezia 2099
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Venezia 2099
154982.description:
A sad prophecy for the wonderful city of Venice: the fact that it will be sinking into the sea seems to be inevitable. Venice is a city built on more than 100 islands. The water, however, surrounds the city and when it rises, you will great bodies of water form and the ever-disappearing streets will be impassable. What will the future of Venice hold?

The year is 2099 and Venice is sinking. Players take on the role of art collectors and try to save as many treasures and artworks as possible. Strategic thinking is required to save the masterpieces. Gondolas are used to escape the floodwaters. The players move on floating platforms, wishing to avoid being in the part of town that is sinking...'
The 8 by 8 board depicts Venice. At the start of the game, all land and bridge tiles are randomized in the plastic frame. Each player receives 3 tokens that they place anywhere on the board. All tiles have a value (higher numbers equating with higher value). Each player is also dealt 5-9 cards and receives 9 coins.

The game ends when all dealt cards have been played. On their turn, players must play their lowest numbered card. The cards are numerical from 3-8.

When playing a card, the tile that has the same number is flipped over to its water side, eventually flipping a tile with a player's token. Players use the two gondola cards, enabling them to rescue their tokens to another tile. The tokens excavate treasures by travelling to a specifically coloured tile and exchanging one coin for the corresponding coloured treasure.

When all cards have been played, there remains part of the map that is not submerged. These remaining tiles are used to calculate the value of the treasures by rarity.

Microbadges:

154983.name: Salto do Cavalo
154983.description: Salto do Cavalo is a game for two played on a 5x5 grid of 25 squares. Each player has a one piece in a different shape or color than the other player. There are 23 neutral pieces that are also used. Play begins with an empty board but for each player being stationed in an opposite corner of the board. Players then take turns moving their piece like a Knight in Chess, and placing a neutral piece to mark where the player began their move. Players may not move onto these neutral pieces. The last player to make a move wins the game.

154984.name: Suburbia: Hala Stulecia
154984.description:
Suburbia: Hala Stulecia (The Centennial Hall) is a promo added to the Polish edition of Suburbia Inc., named after The Centennial Hall UNESCO Heritage building in Wrocław (where the Polish publisher comes from).

The Centennial Hall is a B-tile, which gives its owner +1 reputation per each adjacent tile (including lakes) but lowers your income by one. There are two of these tiles available. The expansion also includes two Redevelopment Planner tiles.

Hala Stulecia is four tiles in a 'punch-out' cardboard, outside of the box.

154985.description:
Objective: Eliminate your opponent/
- moving/acting by turns -

Gameboard is your battlefield. You have several different military units with different qualities (range, power,...) at your disposal.
1. Place your 25 units into the red/blue marked areal.
2. Advance your units
3. Attack if enemy is within allowed range & vulnerable by your unit
4. Remove defeated units

Notes:
Likely published mid 1930's;
can be played also with more payers (even numbers/units are separated)
154985.name: Kampf und Sieg

154986.name: Meta
154986.description: Meta is an abstract game for two played on a 4x4 grid of 16 squares. Each player has four pieces of a different color or shape, one each labeled with one of these letters: M, E, T, A. Play begins with each player's pieces lined next to each other in the board's middle two rows, spelling out M-E-T-A. Players take turns moving their pieces to one empty adjacent square, vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. The first player to move all of his pieces to the furthest row and spell M-E-T-A wins the game. There are variations depending on how to start the game and whether to use the letters, and in which direction the letters should face.

154987.name: Penim
154987.description: Penim is a variant of Nim, played with five kinds of pieces: 11 small circles, 9 short rounded rectangles, 7 small squares, 5 long rounded rectangles, and 3 large squares. The pieces are organized into heaps and the players take turns removing the pieces until none are left. The last player to remove a piece wins the game. The rules provide for varying degrees of difficulty, with different combinations of the pieces being used and different rules for who can take what piece.

154988.name: Steel Diver: Sub Wars
154988.description:
UNSINKABLE UNDERSEA FUN

Load the torpedo tubes and crash dive into fast-paced undersea combat. Use your Nintendo 3DS system to take the helm of sleek subs in engaging single-player missions and intense multiplayer shootouts.

AVAILABLE EXCLUSIVELY ON NINTENDO eSHOP - DOWNLOAD FOR FREE

Find your sea legs in two intense single-player missions and take your sub into local and online multiplayer battles.

You can purchase the Premium version to unlock five more underwater adventures and a formidable 18-vessel sub fleet.

CLASH BENEATH THE WAVES

Use innovative touchscreen controls to square off against other sub captains in tense, 4-against-4 team battles. Recruit three comrades or go it alone with computer-controlled teammates, then let the underwater fireworks begin. You can battle either locally or online, so there's always an opportunity for combat.

CHOOSE FROM 18 UNIQUE SUBS

CUSTOMIZE YOUR SUBS

Once you find some subs you like, you can make them your own with the game's customization tools. Go with a stealthy paint job, or announce your presence in battle with bright colors and crazy patterns.

DIVE INTO SOLO MISSIONS:

Navigate the Rings
Sink the Convoy
Eliminate the Radar Base (Premium)
Undersea Nemesis (Premium)
Final Showdown (Premium)

Source: The Publisher Website.

154990.description:
The players start at the train station and try to get their car to the hotel (or reverse) as soon as possible. The first to arrive at his destination, wins the game.

The moves of the cars are determined by a die. When a player rolls a 6, he has to move the turntable under the game board one notch further with his steering wheel. This changes the traffic signs and the traffic lights. If a car arrives on an occupied space, an accident occurs and the arriving car has to head for the repair shop. Each player starts with 6 gas markers. For every 1 he rolls, he has to spend 1 marker. The markers can be regained at the gas station. If all markers are spend, the player has to withdraw from the game.
154990.name: Achtung: Rot!

154991.name: Set Europe Ablaze: The Resistance War 1939-1945
154991.description:
[from publisher's website]
Gestapo. Resistance. Careful plans. Desperate measures. The Germans move Security troops to the scene of the latest sabotage outbreaks. The French shut down Networks to prevent them being overcome by police and security forces. Ever want to parachute arms into France to support the Resistance?
